Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated. Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam91
Reviews.Content: Just spent a lovely Easter Weekend at Hotel Monaco. Newly renovated. Friendly staff, excellent customer service. Super clean rooms. Modern. Great location. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Funky - Friendly -”
Reviews.Author: Chantal L
Reviews.Content: I had happened to get this hotel on Hotwire. I never have used the site, but I am really glad I did. We arrived at the hotel around 4:30pm. The valet took our keys and we went to check in. We were greeted and helped right away. The lobby was nice and staff was friendly. They advised us that we came at the right time since they are doing some renovations to the hotel. After going up to our room, there were men working in the hallway quiet loudly. I could hear their saws and hammers. I really just wanted to take a nap after a long boarder line up. There were empty wine glasses on the floor; I thought that was really odd. We turned the corner and our room was tucked in a little hallway. The hallway to the stairs was unfinished and opened. This being my first impression, I was nervous to open the door to our room. When we did, the room was very nice. It was really clean and up to par with cool technology features. (I could plug in my iPod, charge my iPhone, blackberry and GPS) The bed could have used more blankets. But we turned our heat up to accommodate that. :) The room also did smell like fresh paint, but we got use to it. The noise outside stopped around 5:15 and we went downstairs to have a glass of wine. Oh ya, they have happy hour, for free :) We had some wine and were shown a magic trick or two. It was a very nice extra little touch. We walked around the hotel and checked out the other amenities. (The work out room is small but had most of the equipment we were looking for) Then we had a night on the town. We came back from eating and sightseeing to get a little cozy in our room. The showers are very nice and the products they use are not those nasty shampoos that leave your hair dry and only enough for one person to take a shower. They had ample amount! We checked out around 9... Their check out is 12! This is really nice if you just want to lounge. We would stay here again... :)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elvira P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco Seattle recently and we are already planning another stay at this hotel. You get excellent customer service from the moment you step in to the front desk to the end from every hotel employee. The rooms are lively, spacious and every detail for the well being of the guest has been taken into consideration. The hotel is centrally located and walking distance to all important attractions, restaurants, coffee shops and shopping. Parking was expensive, we were lucky enough to find a space by the bar window every night. Awesome place and customer service!

Reviews.Title: “New Rooms are Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: keninca
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4 day trip. Great location near the University underground transit stop. Got the lowest total trip price for this hotel (hotel + airfare) through the hotel booking site. Service was excellent: the front desk person went and got our bags as the Bellhop was busy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco Seattle was awesome.”
Reviews.Author: LaVonne O
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for better service than what I received at Hotel Monaco. Their hotel was lovely, clean and well taken care of. The staff was caring and made me feel very important. I highly recommend them as the "go to" hotel in Seattle!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but take advantage of "upon request" items”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: We did a "name your own price" for a random Sunday night and were assigned the Hotel Monaco in downtown Seattle. We've stayed at various Kimpton hotels throughout the country and this did not disappoint. The hotel is currently being renovated and we were a bit worried we would get one of the "old" rooms but we did not. Our room was updated, clean, modern and (for the most part) quiet. After looking at the website and reading the reviews on TripAdvisor prior to our arrival, we were expecting a pet goldfish in our room as well as turndown service at night (we've always had turndown service at other Kimptons). We didn't get either and after re-reviewing the website found out that these items are "upon request." That was a little disappointing, especially since it was a quiet Sunday night and the hotel wasn't full by any stretch of the imagination. Another nit-pick: the hotel's website says their wine reception from 5-6 pm offers "worldly and wise" wines. Eh, not so much. They were pouring Columbia Crest Two Vines Cabernet, a bottle of which can be purchased in the grocery store for $6.99. Not so wordly or wise! Oh well. It's free I guess! The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large with good water pressure in the shower and no shortage of hot water for an older building. We could hear our neighbor early on Monday morning on the phone so it could have been a bit quieter but we understood guests on Monday morning may be conducting early business from their rooms. All in all, no major complaints and for the "name your own price" it was a good deal. Be aware, there is only valet parking and it will run you $40+ dollars a night with tax. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Finally got to bring a dog to enjoy the service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: barbnstu
Reviews.Content: Husband and I have stayed at the Seattle Hotel Monaco on several occasions over the past 15 years. We have always thoroughly enjoyed the colorful and eclecticly fun decor, the wine hour, the convenient downtown location, and the sincerely hospitable service. The rooms are quiet - our most recent stay we were located on the 3rd floor facing the street, and our room was next to the elevators. In another hotel I might have asked to be higher to avoid street noise, or further from the elevators, but here there were no concerns about noise and I am sensitive about this. We have never traveled with a pet before so this visit was a bit of a test to see if our 6 month old springer spaniel would be okay on an overnight in a big city. A couple of calls to the hotel prior to our visit allayed most of my concerns - the hotel is truly pet friendly - no added cost for a pet, and they will puppysit for free for the first two hours, if the guest is going out, and $10 per hour after that. (They will keep the pet behind the front reception desk). There is a patch of green across the street in front of the library for the dogs convenience, and this did work for us, but alas, there were no other patches of green in the immediate neighborhood. But, this is a downtown hotel and that is to be expected. Everybody was indeed very accommodating to us and to our puppy, they delivered puppy treats and toy and cleanup bag to the room. Also, we enjoyed a very lovely complimentary wine hour downstairs (main lobby is currently under renovation, looks to be completed soon, can't wait to go back and see how it looks!) and our dog was loving all that socialization. There were some kids at the social hour, and a guy did some magic tricks to entertain them, that was new to us! Also, we got parking at the hotel at half price because we drive a fuel efficient car, nice perk, thank you. We belong to the Kimpton loyalty program which is free and a great idea, we got free internet, and also a $10 coupon to "raid the mini bar". We were very very happy with the fresh new look in the rooms and as always we love the staff - we will keep this hotel as our #1 choice in Seattle. Our puppy also gives four paws up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations underway, but the same great Kimpton service!”
Reviews.Author: jillian07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle and even though they were "undergoing renovations", we still received the same great Kimpton service. Our room was one of the newly renovated rooms and it was nicely appointed with a super comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER disappoints”
Reviews.Author: sealiz
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle for three evenings. They are undergoing a renovation and the newly renovated room that I had was fresh, had good amenities e.g., each side of the bed had a plug for me to plug in my computer! Colors are really nice. Workout room is nice as well. What makes this hotel so great is their staff. Top notch and makes everybody who walks through the door feel welcomed. Just amazing. The location of this hotel is excellent as well - walkable to everything. The link from the airport stops 2 blocks away from the hotel and is an excellent alternative to cabs and super shuttle. I highly recommend this property. Every time I stay here I just fall "in like" again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and this hotel is just "ok"”
Reviews.Author: ctyankee20
Reviews.Content: Rooms are ok-decent sized, fit and finish is unspectacular, no views to speak of. Staff is ok but don't valet your car because it takes weeks to come back. Restaurant average. Hotel is not super expensive but it probably fair value at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: baltimorebeachbum
Reviews.Content: Fun and funky! Our poor Marco the goldfish died within hours of having him :-( Nice room, great staff! Great location. Enjoyed the happy hour. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: sparky56
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for nearly a week for a conference, so I got a good conference rate. This is a smallish boutique hotel within easy walking distance of Convention Center and downtown. There is good dining very nearby as there seems to be all over downtown Seattle. I did not eat at the property. Service at reception was always helpful and friendly. Room was very nice and well maintained. Hall was quiet. I liked the eclectic decor of the lobby. Starbucks coffee and major newspapers were available in lobby each morning. Airport town car service was readily available and seemed competitive with a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: scasey05
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Hotel Monaco. The rooms were gorgeous and huge, bed so comfortable, staff was super accommodating and the location was great. Although the price is a little high, it is well worth it as this was one of my best hotel experiences ever. They are also pet friendly which is nice and a lovely goldfish (courtesy of the hotel) was my roommate for the stay. I have since joined the Kimptons loyalty plan and will definitely stay at their hotels when available.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Mags2033
Reviews.Content: I spent many nights here on business trips over the past several years -- so many in fact that I (sadly) joked with the valets and the front desk staff that I saw them more frequently than I saw some of my friends back home. It is a good hotel, very well located and the service is excellent. The property has been refreshed over the past few years (and I believe is still being done).

Reviews.Title: “Monaco Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Richard J
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, highly recommended. Great location in downtown Seattle. Easy walking distance to quality dining, not far from the Space Needle. It was a business trip but still had a great time and enjoyed my stay at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Rather poor service”
Reviews.Author: Shainanelson
Reviews.Content: My husband just returned from a long deployment with the USS Stennis and had our first chance at a night out together without the kiddies in nearly a year. I bought tickets for the Teatro Zinzanni and in doing so browsed their hotel 'sponsor' list. The idea of a jacuzzi tub in our room appealed to me greatly and after looking around the internets I didn't come across another hotel that offered this amenity. I booked the deluxe Mediterranean suite reading over the descriptor four times to be sure I selected the correct room with this awesome tub and then another four times when the confirmation came in my email. I asked for an 'early check in'. I called the day before to confirm everything and told them the time we were planning to get in which was noon. The guy confirmed they shouldn't have an issue with this and if a room wasn't ready they could certainly hold onto our luggage. We finally arrived, although a bit later than planned by an hour. A room was not ready but they held onto our things while we walked around downtown and got lunch. We returned about 3pm and was informed our room was finally ready. (Yay! Jucuzzi tub to rest our achy feet!). The next bit I found a bit odd having traveled around the world and stayed in various hotels of various stars. Instead of the bellhop taking our key, luggage, and us up to our room we were handed our key by guest services and the bellhop attempting to drop our luggage at our feet. We were puzzled and the kid finally gets it and asks if we want it taken up. Well, yes. He takes off with our things and says for us to head on up that he'll be right there. Our room: Major Major Major Horrible Massive Dissapointment. As soon as I walked in I said to my husband 'This is not our room.' Checked through the entire room and it most certainly was not what we paid for. There is NO jacuzzi tub and to add insult to injury our view is of a parking garage. I call the front desk and am informed that there was a burst pipe as of that morning and therefore half the rooms of that kind were flooded. So there WAS 4 rooms but we JUST missed them although we were there earlier as per original request. It was 'Unforseen' so it wasn't something they could work out with us. The guy did tell me that if he had checked us in he would have told us and apologized. Offered us a 'discount' of $50 (so obviously doing us a favor). Being that I was so utterly dissapointed and, well, peeved, I chose to bite my tongue and accepted it graciously. Essentially, my room was handed off to someone in the time we were out for lunch and there was no intention of some form of reimbursement. After finishing up with that large debacle, we noticed that our luggage hadn't arrived. 20 minutes had passed, where was that lazy bellhop? My husband left to find out and caught the kid getting off the elevator with our luggage: 'I'm sorry. We got busy.' and then lingered at our door waiting for a tip. Yeah, not going to happen. So that was a rather small issue but like I said, having traveled a lot my idea of what's supposed to happen at a hotel is obviously very different than this particular locale. On a side note: the food, phenomenal. The restaurant and bar room service: Excellent. The valet service: Excellent. we will not be staying here again. I will not be recommending it. And if I had known we wouldn't be getting a jacuzzi tub I would have booked a room at W Seattle for the same price that actually INCLUDED valet parking in the cost not just as a hospitality as I later learned upon arrival at the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “This might be our favorite Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: tikiville
Reviews.Content: We made last minute reservations (day before) for an overnight in Seattle. The benefits of being a Kimpton In-touch member certainly paid off, we had a decent rate, free parking and a $20 dinning credit. The room was beautiful we love how each room is a bit different and it's not like the "standard" whenever you stay at a Kimpton, unless the standard is "cool"! We had very friendly and helpful service from when we dropped the car off at valet all the way to check out the following morning. When we dropped off the car we mentioned that we'd need a taxi in about 30 mins, as soon as we came back out the valet mentioned that he hadn't been able to get a taxi yet, but that there was a town car available that would take us where we needed to go for the same price as a taxi. Bonus! A very nice gentleman then took us to Queen Anne and it was much more pleasant than a taxi. We just appreciated that on a busy Saturday night the valet actually remembered that we had requested a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with nice little extras”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Kimpton hotel, and I have to say I was pleased. We had a very late check in, so I was happy to have a speedy experience at the front desk. We ordered a quick bite with room service, which was a nice to have available so late at night, and it arrived quickly. We had a Monaco King room which was pretty spacious, with a desk area, lots of room, and a really comfortable bed. The only thing I wasn’t really crazy about was our shower had built in dispensers of shampoo and conditioner instead of individual bottles. They do, however, offer a handful of amenities at the front desk such as toothpaste and the like if you forget to pack them (some free, others for a fee). We had an issue with our mini fridge, and not only did they service it right away but they immediately brought a cold drink from the bar downstairs since what we wanted from the fridge wasn’t cold. At every encounter the staff was friendly and efficient. Ask for a goldfish, and your stay is complete! It is centrally located so you can walk to many attractions in the city. It’s extremely close to Pike Place Market, and you can walk down to the original Nordstrom. They have complimentary coffee in the morning, and I think a cocktail hour in the evenings? We booked the $1 breakfast, which was okay – for $1 it’s a perfectly fine continental breakfast, but don’t expect to be full. There’s actually a great little bakery across the street down a block by the Fairmont that I would recommend for excellent pastries like ham and cheese croissant, cinnamon buns, etc. I would stay here again, and will probably seek out their properties in other cities. I also recommend joining their loyalty club for some nice extra perks like free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUVtheNW
Reviews.Content: We are in a recently renovated 8th floor Mediterranean King Room. It is Big and Beautiful. Very chic! The two person jetted tub is DEEP :0 Lots of cool details throughout the room. No view At ALL tho. We walked in with no reservations and asked to book a Mediterranean King Room. The front desk clerk said they were booked. I told him I had just seen four room categories available on line within the hour. He then said he had found one room available, but couldn't offer AAA or Gov't rate. The rate from the front desk was $45 higher than what I'd just seen on line (with AAA ($186) and also included a $20 dining credit in their outstanding restaurant, Sazerac), so I stepped into the lobby made the reservation and waited for it to show up on their system (that made time for a quick drink anyway.... :) The front desk staff were very pleasant throughout the process and offered to store our bags while we got things arranged. Check out our photos of Room 801. We love Kimpton Hotels and will be enjoying their complimentary wine hour in the gorgeous lobby shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Janne P
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days at Hotel Monaco in the beginning of February. I got a nice large room, great service. Love the coffee service in the morning - takes about a minute to grab a coffee to go and internet was fast. In short, my stay was a pleasure. Will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't go back . . .”
Reviews.Author: JKW3
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here on business quite some time ago, and everything was excellent. This time, we were not as impressed. The service was still excellent. And they have complimentary wine in the lobby for an hour each evening. That was nice! And the location is great -- walking distance to Pike's Market and lots of shopping. One of the first things I noticed when we got to our room was that the upholstered chair next to the bed was in tatters. No kidding. In at least four places it was not just threadbare, but literally torn down to the stuffing. For a hotel of this quality, this is completely unacceptable. Perhaps one of their doggie-guests been chewing on the chair. That's another thing. We didn't realize it was a pet-friendly hotel. I don't know if that's a new thing, but my husband never saw any pets there the first time around. Maybe because it was during the week, and this time we were there on a weekend. I'm fond enough of dogs, but I don't really want them staying in the hotel rooms that I stay in. However, it's my fault for not noticing the pet-friendly tags on their website beforehand. The dogs were well-behaved overall. There were several in the lobby off and on, and we heard barking twice from our room. Lastly, the weekend rate in February was a great deal, we thought. But that was before we added in the cost to valet park. It's posted $36 a night, but with taxes it was about $44/night. So be sure to figure that when you're looking at room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice staff & warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgrs2go
Reviews.Content: I called before I arrived and the staff was so friendly and helped me arrange dinner reservations for when I arrived. Hotel Monaco is only a couple blocks from the light rail, so from the Seattle Airport it is only $2.75pp. Get off at University. Just a 30 minute ride. Easy. When checking in again the staff was so nice and the room was good size and clean. The only negative is request another blanket for the bed. There is no bed covering. We just like the feel of a heavier blanket. Food at Sazar was good and reasonable. Busy at the bar at night. We really enjoyed our stay at the Monaco. You can walk to everything. Just if you go down to the pier it is a heavy climb back to the hotel, so just get a taxi, it is only $4. OH and the Seattle libary is right across the street. I would recommend this hotel if visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Hotel Monaco for a trip after Christmas and the location of the hotel can't be beat. We walked to the Public Market, shopping each day and to dinners. The staff was extremely helpful on giving directions and suggestions on places to eat near by. Not only were they helpful, but so friendly and remembered us each time we arrived back to the hotel. The restaurant in the lobby had great food too...highly recommend it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: Joe T
Reviews.Content: I waited too long to make reservations for Tech Ready week so I couldn’t get a room at the Sheraton where I normally stay. Even though it was a few blocks away from the convention center I decided to give Hotel Monaco a try. I was impressed with everything about this hotel. The staff seemed genuinely helpful, the bar was great, and the room was huge! I had my wife with me for the first few days; she took advantage of the in-room spa services, which she loved. We ate at Sazerac, the hotel restaurant, it was very good. Like a lot of places right now they do the whole elevated southern thing. I recommend the ribs. Around day three I told my wife that I would be staying here instead of the Sheraton from now on. This all changed on day five. I got back to the hotel around midnight. Normally there would be a valet to park my rental but as it was pretty late there was no one out front. I parked on the curb directly in front of the hotel and went inside to see how I could get my car in the garage. There was no one at the front desk. I waited a few minutes…. Still no one. I reluctantly walked behind the desk and into the back office thinking someone may have been snoozing (I’ve worked a lot of graveyard shifts myself), however there was no one. I decided to head up stairs and try to call the front desk from my room (I thought maybe the phone had been forwarded). When I got to my room and tried my key I got the dreaded red light. This was the second time my key stopped working during my stay. At this point I’m not thrilled. I went back down to the lobby… Still no one. I headed to the bottom floor which was roped off and said under construction (or something of that sort) I checked a few of the bathrooms and conference rooms… Nobody. I decide to give up, leave the car out front and let the hotel deal with it whenever someone showed up. On my way back up I realize I can’t just give up, because my KEY DOESN’T WORK! I pass the front desk, no one is there but I think I hear someone in the office. I call out… a gentleman came out of the back office, it was apparent I had interrupted a meal as he had a mouth full of food. I asked him if he had left the hotel because I have been walking around looking for someone for thirty minutes. He seemed annoyed that I questioned where he had been and told me that he had not be gone “that long”. I decided then that I wasn’t going to bother arguing with him. I asked him to please take care of the car and replace my room key. I handed him my room key and put my ID on the desk. He took my key asked me what room I was in, hit a couple of keys, replaced my card. However he did NOT, I repeat he did NOT once look at my ID. I just stared at him in amazement. So not only was the hotel door unlocked with no one in the front lobby but apparently if you have an old hotel key and ask for a new key to room 305 at midnight you get one without question. Considering my pregnant wife was sleeping in that room just a few nights prior, I was not happy at the hotels blatant disregard for basic security. I spoke with the manger the next day who I must say was a complete professional. She did her best to assure me that this was not the norm and the situation would be dealt with immediately. I can’t help but think that something like this would not happen at a hotel with more than one person working the night shift. I guess it’s back to the Sheraton for me.. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Rob J
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco in Downtown Seattle is an exceptional hotel; not just for its great location in the heart of the city, not just for the excellent and clean facility, price and room quality but primarily for its staff. From doorman to manager the Monaco excels in delivering an exceptional customer experience in making you feel welcome everytime you step through the front door. When visiting it is a must to experience the wine reception or a beverage in the bar and to take the time to get to know the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, except”
Reviews.Author: Caymanqueen_10
Reviews.Content: Great place - except you have to pay for wi-fi - seriously ? At your prices, in this day and age???? Everyhting else was perfect. Joan K

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Abananers
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with our stay at Hotel Monaco. The staff were friendly, the room was clean and the restaurant was awesome. The restaurant has an open kitchen and we enjoyed sitting at the bar talking with the chef. The food was the best we had the entire trip. There were only two downsides: the view from our room, right into another building...and the parking. We own a large pickup truck which was too tall for most standard (6'8) parking garages. Neither the front desk or the doorman could direct us to a lot that would accomodate our truck. It took us an hour to find parking 8 blocks away. However, after that hour, we had a wonderful time and enjoyed the hotel and the city. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service!”
Reviews.Author: khloe1
Reviews.Content: The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the restaurant food was very good you have to try the grits! Room service was very slow. Asked for 2 more spoons to share our dessert, never got them. Asked for more wash cloths, 20 minutes later received hand towels? Bathroom sink was not cleaned after we got back from going out for the day. For the price I expected better service

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: hnewman7611
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Great location and amenities. In Seattle over Thanksgiving and enjoyed warm hospitality in their spacious lobby, complimentary mulled drinks and comfortable ambiance. Rooms were very clean, modern, and quiet. Easy access to light rail transportation 1 block from hotel and walking distance to shopping and Pike St. Market., We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: tnostrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco late last December. When I called to make the reservation I casually mentioned to the central booking agent that it was our anniversary. Honestly, I didn't do this to curry favor. When we arrived the receptionist mentioned our anniversary and gave us a room upgrade. It was unexpected and delightful as well. It was a room with a sitting area, plush and spacious. That evening a bottle of champagne and chocolates showed up in our room! Beyond that, every employee that we met, without exception, seemed genuinely interested in making our stay better. They also had a wine tasting social that was extremely well done with healthy pours. Stem to stern our stay was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: DonRobin B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco Seattle. The location was perfect. The staff was very kind and helpful. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The decor of our room gave it a very homey feel. Loved siting in the lobby in the morning by the window and watch the city wake up. The restaurant was very good with excellent wait staff, especially John. Very easy to walk to wherever we wanted to go. Pike Place, movie theaters and downtown shopping just a few blocks away. Several excellent restaurants also within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Dakotacoast
Reviews.Content: My business trip to Seattle felt a little like being at a friend's house because of the warm, homey atmosphere at the Hotel Monaco. My other co-workers stayed across the street at the W and were turned off by the corporate feel and dark, cold surroundings there. I had free internet (thanks to becoming and on the spot Kimpton rewards member), free wine every night (not high end, just casual), and free $10 from the mini-bar. The robes were cozy, the room was warm and had the feel of an international traveler's home. The restaurant was amazing! Fresh, local food, including oysters and the best polenta I have ever had. You can walk to Pike Place and most downtown offices and shopping. The staff was very helpful and suggested a town car to the airport my early morning trip back instead of the cab for the same price. Complementary umbrellas for walks at night and a little doggie chalkboard in the back with names of doggie guests were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: DCBATS
Reviews.Content: Good, not great. Hotel has a circus-like feel. Can walk to lots of restaurants, attractions, and coffee shops! The staff is helpful and friendly. The gym is really small - only has one treadmill. The afternoon wine hour is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice property in good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: I must say, the Hotel Monaco struck me as a bit odd. I've never been to a hotel where colorful nature murals adorn vaulted ceilings in the lobby. The whole place feels a bit plastic and out of place. That said, the staff was very helpful and the hotel had some nice amenities that give it a nice touch. If you're looking for a luxury hotel where everything is adorned in gold, this isn't your place. In fact, I'd call it entry-level luxury. Not so much luxury, but comfort, spaciousness, perfect cleanliness, and attentive service. The evening wine tastings are a nice touch. The location is an easy walk to the water, Pike Place, or shopping. The bed was comfortable and the place had all the equipment you'd expect in a hotel like this. Some of the touches, like the alarm clock, felt very chain-like, reminding me of what every Hilton in the world equips it's rooms with. But the Monaco has subtle touches that make it stand out and give you a warm feeling, with a room decor that almost evokes a British tea room. Overall, a nice hotel, nothing outrageous, but the value proposition was very good as my girlfriend and I celebrated our birthdays in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: linlu65
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the most friendly receptionist I have ever encountered. She was very helpful and efficient. Our kids loved the pet goldfish in our room. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The restaurant was great too and we looked forward to our breakfast every morning. The location is handy to the attractions of Seattle. We took the bus to Museum of Flight without a problem. Pike markets are an easy walk from hotel. The only downside is the walls are a bit thin and we could here a barking dog on occasion - coming from Australia we are not used to dogs in hotels. I would stay here again. Almost forgot my husband and I enjoyed the complimentary wine at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ree206
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't my preference but it was the closest I could find near the location I was at. It had snowed in Seattle and I was looking for a hotel near work and this is what I found. Check in was good-front desk agent gave me the "snow" rate which was great. Good to save money when you have an unexpected expense. Not too bad of a price for downtown Seattle at $143 plus taxes. The bellman was also awesome as he was able to find me a town car to go up the hills to my work. Saved me the trouble of having to walk up a couple hills! I also liked how they had a whole bunch of complimentary personal items like a comb, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc. That was really helpful as I had forgot to pack those items. More money saved by the way! The evening shift on 1/18/12 also gave me free tweezers and they normally charge a small fee. That was sweet of them! Room service was excellent! Quick service and yummy food! Not much negatives, some mildew on shower wall, some rust above shower, private bar wasn't fully stocked- they should mark that on the price list. I left a note for front desk about it because I didn't want to be charged for items I didn't take; morning shift 1/19/12 didn't seem as cheery as the evening. Poor thing must've not been awake, she was waiting for the printer to print my receipt and it was right in front of her face; she also couldn't print me an itemized receipt which the room service person told me last night that they could. I was told a receipt would be e-mailed to me and haven't received it yet but it's still early. When I tried to make sure the front desk agent had the right email she kind of snapped at me but quickly caught herself. I just wanted to make sure she had the right email address. I made a quick reminder call to Room Service and the person who picked up (Nick) was very helpful! He actually repeated my email address and took down my number just in case. He said he'd check with the front desk and would call back. He did call back within a few minutes which to me is excellent customer service! Following up on a customer's concern is very important in providing the best customer service! Overall, I'd recommend this hotel. Definitely check out their restaurant, Sazerac!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Judith93
Reviews.Content: This is an wonderful hotel and an excellent value. There are many charming aspects to the hotel, as other reviewer note. But the best thing was the service. Everyone here was extraorinarily helpful; they really went the extra mile to make our trip enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darlin_me
Reviews.Content: Everything was grand!!! My first time to take my Bandit to the city, she and I LOVED it!! Everyone was so nice, she got a bed and treats in our room. She is a very special 3 year old Papillon. Her and I got to wear our fur coats as it snowed during our stay. She got to meet alot of great other dogs and people :) Thank you! We will be back! Kym St.Clair

Reviews.Title: “Love the goldfish!”
Reviews.Author: Aquaweinie
Reviews.Content: Valet parking fee is $40 for the stay with no other options for parking available close by. Maybe reasonable for downtown Seattle but kinda pricey for a one night stay. Got a kick ut do the complimentary pet goldfish. That was a first!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff, Charming Property & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Renee W
Reviews.Content: To be frank, I am a Kimpton girl through and through. Some properties, however, are better than others. This one is a keeper, primarily due to the exceptional service provided by a wonderful group of people including Jordan, Eric, Rob, Mario and Alec. I was accompanied by a few friends on this trip to Seattle, and they had never stayed at a Kimpton hotel before. We were guests for five days, and each day at least one person from my party would comment about the friendly staff and the comfort of the hotel. Though the hotel is currently being renovated, one wouldn't know it as there was no noise, mess, or any other typical clue. In short, we spent five days as if we were right at home. The hotel is comfortable, perfectly located, and charming. However the real jewel of the property is the staff, and for all of their kindness and generosity of spirit I am grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Meh, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Anneliese8
Reviews.Content: My ho-hum experience here started with the chilly reception we received from the night clerk. You know the kind--they look you up and down, decide you are not worthy, and act like checking you in is a big favor. Normally, I could care less, but we'd just arrived from a long train journey, it was dark and rainy out, we had our discombobulated 7-year-old in tow, and could have used some 'hail fellow well met' at that moment. Publicity boasts about catering to the young uns, but I had to search the website the next day to see what was available for him, and then ask, which put the morning staff in a flutter, because the person who checked us in--I'm looking at you, chilly night check-in guy--should have taken care of it. A much heralded gold fish was brought to our room, which then died. Okay, it happens, it is a living thing, but when we called to have it removed--more 7-year-old discombobulation--we were cheerfully told to put it outside the door, and chirpily asked if we'd like another. I know it's just a fish, but the attitude seemed rather cavalier, especially with a child involved. Yes, they have coffee and tea, but 2 days in a row I had to tell them they'd run out of hot water, breakfast tea, and milk. Don't count on it if you are off to business meetings in the morning as I was. And then there is the nickle and diming that I just can't stand when I'm paying hundreds of dollars for a hotel room--one-ply toilet tissue, big bottles of shampoo and soap bolted to the wall, slippers with a "if-you-use-these-we'll-charge-you-$15" tag attached to them. I moved to the Fairmont, got my slippers for free, had beautiful toiletries and was treated to super-friendly service at every juncture. Quirky can carry you only so far--it shouldn't come at the expense, literally and figuratively, of a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Kimpton Style”
Reviews.Author: RWTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for New Year's Eve. As with all other Kimptons, the staff was super helpful and the property spotless. Nobody does it better!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly quirky but good”
Reviews.Author: Gunner7
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is slightly quirky as is the case with many of the hotels in the Kimpton group - but it's good quirky! If you're looking for a hotel that has bags of character and doesn't feel like a generic beige property trying to be a boutique hotel, then this is the hotel for you. There are many nice touches: you can request a goldfish for your room if you like, you can get free coffee & tea in the lobby in the mornings and free wine in the lobby between 5pm-6pm. It's the decor that strikes you most.... lots of patterns that clash such as bold stripey wallpaper with patterned carpets, leopard print & zebra print bathrobes. The restaurant serves a pretty good breakfast and locationwise, it's great too. It's on 4th Avenue right opposite the W hotel, there's a convenience store round the corner on University St and it's only about a 4 or 5 block walk downtown to the stores. There are plenty of restaurants nearby too and it's a short walk down to the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: rika99
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a lot, and the Monaco in Seattle was the best hotel experience I've had in a long time. The decor is funky and charming, and really sets a chic mood in the hotel, and the staff was super-friendly, hip, and welcoming. I was in town for a conference at the convention center, and the hotel was in a perfect location--a few blocks to the convention center, to shopping on Pike and Pine, and to Pike Place Market. I started off in a room with 2 queen beds, but when a family with noisy kids checked in next door to me, the concierge (Alec) was kind enough to move me to a suite for my last night. Both rooms were fabulous, but the suite was definitely palatial and easily spacious enough for a family with kids. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant, and it was delicious (and a great place to linger), but there's also a Starbucks a few doors down, and a Seattle's Best Coffee across the street (in addition to the coffee in the lobby mornings). I've stayed at other Kimpton hotels, but this one by far had the friendliest staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Becca S
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely blew me away! Everyone is exremely friendly and helpful. The rooms had very nice decor and the beds were so comfy! Also, the Monaco is perfectlly located, a 3 minute walk to Pikes Place and around 4 minute walk to the convention centre. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Joan925
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel to stay when in Seattle. The room was well appointed and the bed very comfortable. It's location is perfect for walking to Pike's Place, restaurants and the waterfront. Can't say enough about the staff. We, definitely, will stay there again when in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Service, style & comfort”
Reviews.Author: JacquiBlake
Reviews.Content: A truly beautiful hotel with the appointments that make it uniquely Kimpton. The Monaco Seattle was fantastic in every sense. The location provided for superior ease - whether to go down to the water, Pike's Place Market or walking distance to great restaurants and bars - perfect after business meetings for dining and exercise. Nearby shopping looked exellent but this was a business trip so I made note for future trips. While so close to many things, the doorman was fantastic and quick to offer assistance in providing car service to the airport upon our departure. The room was spacious and left no detail needed. Warm, soft sheets & covers and a superbly comfortable bed in a very clean room. The suite has plenty of room for two and was quite large for one. A nice set-up for working allowed me to conduct business and spread out. Plush towels and robes with a nicely done bathroom topped it off. The complimentary morning coffee and hot chocolate bar in the lobby was fantastic in the morning as was the wine in the evening. While we missed dining in the restaurant it looked divine and my travel colleague had been several times and sang its praises. The decor was gorgeous - and it completely lent itself to the holiday decorating that was classy and not ostentatious. Service was good and the business center had brand new Mac desktops; I had visited to print our boarding passes. I also poked around on the lower floor and would recommend this hotel for business / corporate meetings as well. A nice surprise after arriving home - the manager followed up with personal email. Kimpton does it right and the Monaco Seattle underlined it yet again. While they have two other hotels in the area that I have heard are great, I will defiitely return to the Monaco as it felt comfortable and elegant - and I felt appreciated as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance - dog friendly, too”
Reviews.Author: GoLab
Reviews.Content: This hotel combines two qualities which don't often go together in the hotel industry: elegance and dog friendliness. Like all Kimpton Hotels, dogs are not only welcome at Hotel Monaco but treated as guests complete with welcome bags and name recorded on the lobby pet roster. The hotel will be upgraded to a more modern style in 2012, so you might want to inquire about the status of the renovations before you book. The lobby is elegant and beautiful and the rooms are attractive and extremely welcoming, so we hope the new minimalistic upgrade won't detract from the property's overall warmth and comfort. Hotel Monaco is well-located, within an easy walk to Pike Place market, waterfront and downtown shops and restaurants. We did not try the restaurant but can recommend Tulio Ristorante and is sister hotel, the Hotel Vintage Park, just a couple blocks away. The lobby has a European feel to it and serves as a gathering place for newspaper reading and coffee service in the morning, and wine tasting and snacks in the evening. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located fine classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dewin142
Reviews.Content: Supposedly built in a former bank- welcoming cheerful staff- room 607 is large with Queen bed, no view- good small bath with lighted shave mirror and hairdryer; good bath amenities- T V and purchase films, the latter expensive- Avoid breakfast as it's too pricey; cross the street to the Seattle Brew or turn left to Starbucks- the hotel serves coffee in the Libby until 9 AM and has a 5 PM wine tasting with snacks which is free- only blocks from Pikes Place-

Reviews.Title: “A perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: Dani R
Reviews.Content: We were attending Teatro ZinZanni in Seattle, to celebrate our 45th wedding anniversary, and looking for a nice hotel downtown to make the most of our visit. The Monaco offered a really great price to theater guests, so we gave it a try. Starting right at curbside, with the charming and helpful valets, we knew we made the right choice. The lobby was magical, with its holiday decor, and the desk clerks were professional yet casual at the same time (really?) We felt special when we used the room key-card to reach our "secure" floor in the elevator, and imagine our surprise to find his and hers jungle print bathrobes (which we immediately donned, snapped photos, and texted them to our grandchildren) and a goldfish we named BART to keep us company. The bed was comfortable, room clean and nicely decorated, everything we had hoped for, but it was "the little things" that made it a perfect fit for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen g
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have "getaways" in our own city. We stayed at the Monaco to celebrate our anniversary and spend some holiday time downtown.The staff was amazing. It was the perfect level of service. They were attentive without being overbearing, in a word, the service was excellent. Our room was very nice and they even left us a bottle of champaigne and some chocolates to help us celebrate! Very unexpected and a nice touch. We will definitely stay again at this hotel. We also had breakfast at the restaraunt and it was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent ageing luxury”
Reviews.Author: rrafay
Reviews.Content: Kimpton is starting to earn a pretty bad reputation in my eyes. I stayed at 70 Park Avenue in New York and it was similar. The hotel is nice and what you would expect for the price, but it is just that; nice. Given the comparable hotels in any large city where a Hotel Monaco exists, I fail to understand why anyone would be a repeat customer. The hotel is ageing and not well maintained. We entered the lobby and the carpet was filthy with leaves as if a herd of caribou had just ran through the place. The hotel does not have a life or energy of its own. The hotel rooms are great, well decorated, and well-equipped, but the view I had was of an office building 20 feet from my window... not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Rick W
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco simply gets it right. I have stayed there a number of times and it is always a pleasure. Just book it!

Reviews.Title: “"Whimsical!"”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: We loved the unusual decor! We had a "whimsical" striped room which was very quiet on the 9th floor. Easy efficient check-in with a very pleasant staff. We enjoyed the wine reception in the lobby before dinner. Very comfortable bed and Starbucks coffee in the morning. The room was a nice size although the bathroom was on the small side. Seemed like an older hotel, but well-maintained with an "Alice in Wonderland" quality.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed first time at a Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This stay was mine and my wife's first time at a Kimpton Hotel. We were very impressed, from check in, to the unique layout and design of our room, to the drinks at the restaurant connected to the lobby, this was a very good hotel. My conference was a few blocks away and the conference, along with short walks to Westlake Center, Pike Place Market, etc. were extremely convenient. The fish in our room was a "cool" extra too - we named him/her "Comstock." The best recommendation I can give is that I would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - clean and comfortable, with pleasant touches!”
Reviews.Author: Yammy2801
Reviews.Content: Came to Seattle for a quick getaway before Christmas and our stay at the Monaco was pleasantly relaxing and comfortable. The staff, from the moment our car touched the curbside to checkout, were undoubtedly the warmest and friendliest I've encountered recently. We arrived with our daughter, son-in-law and their newborn baby and the adjoining rooms we shared just fit the bill for our needs. A daily happy hour - what a nice treat! Top it off with the little goldfish bowl in the room and you have a stay to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Oh no, not another perfect hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: ElQuesoGrande
Reviews.Content: Oh, ho hum, this is getting really boring. Perfect stay, perfect staff, perfect 5-6 p.m. hosted wine hour, perfect place for our lovely pooch, perfect pillows, etc., etc. The location of the Monaco is just great and, although our puppy wanted some hot toddies at 5:00 p.m., I was the only one permitted to enjoy them. And of course, they are (my favorite word) free, during the hotel's nightly cocktail hour. The next morning, in addition to fresh-brewed Starbucks coffee (yes, there's that word again, free), there was a seasonally-inspired supply of hot-chocolate, which I mixed with marshmallows and a heap of other goodies. Yes, folks, just another perfect two-day stay in a fabulously-run hotel management company, Kimpton Hotels. Would I ever stay somewhere else? Well, maybe if it was FREE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: msawyer2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice - the lobby, the rooms, and the location. The location was fabulous - my husband and I were able to walk everywhere we went - to the shops, market, restaurants, bars, docks. (There are a lot of hils though - down towards the shopping district was a bit flatter!) We never ate there, so I can't comment on that; but there were plenty of great places around, and the lady at the front desk gave us a breakfast recommendation that was one of the best breakfast I've had ... Lola, right on 4th St.! It was a great weekend, everyone was super nice, and the accomadations were excellent. I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: lovesun34
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Monaco. It was with trepidation that I traveled half way around the world with my nine year old daughter, however when we arrived, having emailed the hotel requesting early check-in, our room was thankfully ready. The check-in was fast and organised. Movie, voucher for my daughter and a mini-bar voucher for me. It is worth joining the Kimpton in-touch program. Best bits:The hotel is perfectly located, we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The beds are comfy, it has nice decor, the cleanliness was fantastic and the pet fish was a nice touch. Finally you can't beat the service, from the door staff, desk staff or restaurant staff, all great. My only word of warning is not to let your kids get to the TV remote first The on- demand is much easier for them to access than the regular programming. I'll end up with a smallish tv bill for on-demand Disney, but I'll put that down to exhaustion and not worry about it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay”
Reviews.Author: misterwiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the finest service and attention to their customers needs. The staff is totally awesome in their efforts to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. The room was beautiful and clean and there was plenty of hot water, no matter what time you took your shower or bath. The lobby was splendidly decorated for the Christmas holidays and the daily Managers Reception was great fun. We made friends with other guests and enjoyed the magicians' tricks when he was there. In addition, the restaurant had excellent food and half price appetizers for happy hour. We were there for 10 nights and were sad to leave. If you are looking for a great place to stay in Seattle, do check this one out. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco-a welcome comfortable surprise”
Reviews.Author: a42N81
Reviews.Content: We usually prefer a more modern aesthetic, but the somewhat 'quirky' decor was fun and a welcome change. Booked an excellent rate on their site and then was upgraded on our arrival and given multiple perks. (Well worth joining the Kimpton loyalty program.) Thoughtful in room touches such as use of yoga kit. Complimentary lovely local wines poured at the wine hour. Helpful staff. (Looking forward to my upcoming stay this weekend at their sister hotel, the Alexis.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Aimers1972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property for a wedding for a friend. The hotel is wonderful! And is a GREAT location-very close to many attractions downtown Seattle. All were in walking distance. The staff was VERY friendly, and always spoke to us when we were coming and going. The free Starbucks coffee and nightly wine receptions were wonderful. When we asked about transportation back to the airport, they secured a town care for us that was less expensive than a taxi. The only negative I would have to say is that the housekeeping staff woke us up early everyday! The walls are really thin in the rooms. i could hear what my neighbors were saying. The beds were uncomfortable, and the rooms were slightly dated. The DM emailed me after my survey, and ssaid they are going to renovate soon. I would definitely stay here again in future trips to the area. I'm going to Chicago soon, and will definitely look at the Kimpton properties in the area! Overall it was a really nice place!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel so much I want to move in!”
Reviews.Author: sparkle331
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with Hotel Monaco and I was more than pleased. It was a little piece of heaven each and every day of my stay in Seattle. Loved, loved, loved my chitah bathrobe. The staff could not have more pleasant and helpful. My bed was like sleeping on a cloud...I will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: ronzalfa
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels that grows more and more comfortable during your stay. Great service from all the staff. The quite intimate lobby space and decor are scaled properly to create that cozy, relaxing space that is missing in so many hotels. Room decor, which was quite unique was also a breath of fresh air. We had booked a Monte Carlo king suite, had a great street view with plenty of space. The restaraunt, Sazerac had some incredible menu items, and the bar must most certainly have some of Seattle's best mixing and serving. Add to all that, having your own private goldfish for local flavor, furnished umbrella, the occasional pet sighting in the lobby, and it just seems very hard to leave at the end of stay. Oh, did I forget to mention the location was superb? My only criticism would be to note I thought the bathtub was rather small. Would I stay there again? Yes...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: abalint
Reviews.Content: Great Service, great food. Close walking distance to touristy sites and the hotel staff was more that accomidating helping my friend and I find reservations, taxis, and directions. I can't say enough good things about the entire hotel staff. It was the most relaxing part of our stay and we tried three different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't take itself too seriously...”
Reviews.Author: NoveltySeeker
Reviews.Content: Gold fish in your room, dogs in the elevator, and an umbrella in your closet (it is Seattle after all). Need I say more. A breath of fresh air in the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is NOT a good "deal"”
Reviews.Author: TradeshowMagician
Reviews.Content: I added the $1 breakfast deal. In truth, the breakfast voucher is only worth $11 credit in the restaurant. I had egg whites, tomato, toast, juice, and coffee. The cost was $24! With my breakfast voucher I still owed $14... This was NOT a good deal. (the hotel did remove the full charge for the breakfast after complaining, but I did not use my other two vouchers for my other two nights stay after my first costly experiance). The hotel is great, the restaurant is not.

Reviews.Title: “Some welcomed class in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Lollslynne
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Seattle, near the Public Library, is this gem of a hotel. A bit more pricey than I normally like, but was a nice treat for the 'girls weekend' we were on. Close to some great restaurants (see Purple in particular) and about a 10 minute walk to most tourist attractions. Rooms comparable to Starwood brand hotels. Probably too fancy for a family on a budget or a solo traveller. Wine reception was a good idea, but the wines offered were limited and unappealing to my palette. Will stay here again if I have some extra cash.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Playlonger
Reviews.Content: Came to Seattle for a football game. Hotel was perfect location close enough to walk yet also close enough to the city center. Loved the hotel we had a pet goldfish on our room throughout the stay, the staff was very accommodating . The only downfall was the bar ran out of our type of beer one night but that was completely stocked the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: highm
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our daughter in Seattle. We stayed for four days. What a totally wonderful experience at the Hotel Monaco Seattle. Everyone was more than friendly and accommodating. The wine hour was very nice, and we enjoy nice wines, and theirs had the taste and appeal of fine wine. The entire hotel had the appeal of a nice, fine, hotel. It was a super experience, and one that I hope to repeat, the next time that I visit my daughter in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fun decor, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Solegirl73
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at a Kimpton hotel, and I am now a fan. The location was perfect as I was only minutes away from Pike Public Market (must have breakfast @ Lowell's). The decor is certainly not generic. As you enter the room, you first notice the salmon pink stripe wallpaper. The blue headboard with blue vases on the wall, and even the desk chair has a blue back to match...equal fun decor. I also enjoyed the complimentary wine happy hour between 5 and 6 pm. It was a nice opportunity for me to test a WA cabernet. The complimentary coffee and tea in the morning is nice plus as well. I will be back when in Seattle. Nice place, nice location, nice people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: kells277
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to pike place so this locale was great and valet was 24 hour access so we could go out to Ballard ave for dinner and hen come back later. Clean room and great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Content: We thought we'd try a different hotel, and the pictures looked intriguing. Upon check in we were pleasantly surprised to find they had upgraded us to a king size room. Check in was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. We liked the free wine bar they put on between five and six pm, and the happy hour price (between 4 and 8pm) for wine and appetizers were a good deal. The location is ideal, within easy walking distance to Pike Place Market, downtown shopping and Pioneer Square. The decor in the room was different from the standard hotel, a nice change. We thought the chocolates on the bed every evening was a nice touch. A few complaints: The animal print robes felt kind of grubby, and the doors slammed when people left their rooms. Also, we had no choice but to use the valet parking. But other than that we had an enjoyable experience and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great wedding home base”
Reviews.Author: markdeloura
Reviews.Content: We used the Hotel Monaco as home base for our recent wedding in Seattle. We chose the Monaco because it is very personal: they go our of their way to make you feel welcome, from the guys who greet you at the front door, to the complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, to the goldfish they will give you for your room if you ask. We wanted our guests to have the same welcoming feeling, since many of them were traveling in from out of town and hadn't visited Seattle previously. During our visit the staff was very friendly and accommodating, understanding some of our weird requests (for example, we asked that our guests' goldfish be named "Cupid") and helping us out when we were in a pinch (a tux was left in a taxi trunk and the hotel recovered it for us.) The cost we worked out for the group rate was a little higher than nearby chain hotels, but we feel it was very much worth it. The Monaco will be our go-to hotel for all our visits to Seattle in the future, and we suspect it will be for our guests as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad choice of wine”
Reviews.Author: VancouverHoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas time 2010 and had a very enjoyable stay. The boutique hotel is really nice, friendly staff and great location. They have a wine hour which is great, aside from the fact that the only wine they have is Barefoot. That surpises me for a 4 star hotel. I enjoy good wine, and can also drink not-so-good wine, just not Barefoot. It's horrible. I couldn't drink it, so had champagne instead which was great. And since our group was the only one drinking it, by the end of the hour we were given the bottle to finish. That was a nice touch. Hotel is clean and charming with it's boutique decor. Was a great stay, no doubt. I would just say, for the quality of the hotel, bump up the quality of the wine.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AnEnglandTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at this hotel. While it's not in center of downtown, it's only a four or five block easy walk to the action. We we really looking forward to staying here and were not disappointed! The room was more like a suite with a separate bedroom. This was great so we could actually relax in our room and not have only the bed to lie on. We had breakfast at the attached restaurant (we had a breakfast deal with the hotel). While it was just fine, I would recommend getting out and take advantage of some of the other breakfast establishments in the area. Be sure and attend the evening wine reception. What a nice way to end your day or start your night....! The room was in decent shape. Though one of the chairs in the living area was ripped on both arms and there was some mold on the upper wall of the shower. Neither of these things would deter me from staying here again. We were on the sixth floor on the 4th Avenue side. We didn't have any issues with street noise and only had noisy neighbors one of the nights.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable atmosphere with exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lauramcskeane
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is always one of our favorites. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very comfortable. It's central location is fantastic. You can rest assured you will have a wonderful stay in this Kimpton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CJW372”
Reviews.Author: CJW372
Reviews.Content: First time in Seattle and first time in a Kimpton Hotel. Great experience for both. Hotel was VERY conveniently located and we were able to walk to everything - Pike's Market, shopping & great restaurants. We already had made dinner reservations elsewhere, but did do apps and drinks at Sazerac's in the hotel. Great atmosphere and food. Would definitely eat there on our next trip. Nice completmentary wine hour where we met some other guests and got some suggestions for places to see. Staff was very accommodating. Overnight parking fee was pretty spendy, but it appeared to get the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to details”
Reviews.Author: SmallBusinessOwner
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle. My room was spacious, very nicely appointed, everything was working perfectly, and it was incredibly comfortable for working in-room or just sitting and reading. The hotel itself is lovely and they have coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoons, so there's always a feeling that you're welcome and they're happy to see you. Had room service both days, and they accepted small modifications I requested to the standard menu without batting an eye. Desk service and concierge service was great and very helpful. This is a great hotel for the business traveler - makes it easy to work and to relax. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: cakesbyamy
Reviews.Content: Although we were just in Seattle for an overnight stay, we highly recommend staying at the Kimpton Hotels. They are always a reliable positive experience, and their attention to detail made us feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “A true boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: romdomsky
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at the Hotel Monaco. Over the years on our bi-annual trips to Seattle, we've stayed at a variety of hotels and this hotel is our favorite by far. Strongest points: a fun and pleasing decor with lots of verve and flair in the lobby and guest rooms, a pleasant and helpful staff and cosy, non-generic rooms that make you feel at home immediately. Also the room rate was very reasonable. The size of the hotel is perfect if you're seeking a more intimate feel than the quality chain hotels in Seattle provide. Both the hotel and its attached restaurant Sazerac have real character and zazz…..more so than many of the high-end traditional style hotels in Seattle. We loved the nightly wine hour in the lobby and at Sazerac enjoyed a good breakfast and a couple of terrific happy hours (This bar is rated as offering one of the top 20 happy hours in Seattle and if you've never been to Seattle ---happy hours are big-time here for both drink and food.) We requested a higher floor room and were really appreciative when the hotel staff actually did follow through and give us a lovely, quiet room on the 9th floor. The hotel is well-situated. We came in on 'The Link' from the airport and the hotel is only 2 blocks away from the University stop. (note: If you're planning to take the Link into the city from SEATAC airport be prepared for an extremely long walk with your luggage from the Airport terminals to the train. And there's no transport at the airport to the Link.) The hotel is centrally located for restaurants, shops, movie theaters, and an easy walk to many sites including the Seattle Art Museum and Pike's Market. We're definitely planning to make this our destination hotel for future trips to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so so service”
Reviews.Author: gl0betr0tter_dc
Reviews.Content: I like staying at Kimpton Hotels, for their coffee/wine service, robes, and free wifi. The location of the Monaco in downtown Seattle is great. I walked to Pike Place Public Market in 10 minutes with the sublime Sweet Iron waffle shop one block away. Also nearby is the swanky Purple Café and Wine Bar. The light rail is a short few blocks as well. First impressions were a mixed bag. We arrived around 2:00 p.m. and our room was not ready, so the women checking us in told us the bell boy would take our bags, but that didn't happen promptly. We must have stood around for 20 minutes and had to find the bell boy ourselves. Once our room was ready we got keys and access to the express elevator, which only services floors 10-11. The keys did not work on the first try so I had to get another set. Room 1017 was smaller than we expected and the bed a lot firmer, but still comfortable with nice views of downtown. There was an off musty smell in the room, as in the robes, which have seen better days. The bathroom amenities could be nicer. The wine hour was packed with nowhere to sit. Overall, an acceptable stay, but will look elsewhere for my next visit to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: thevinoman
Reviews.Content: Beautiful downtown Seattle location. Perfectly situated to Pike Place Market, shopping, etc, etc. Great lobby, fantastic service and very comfy rooms. Very restful and really fun decor. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, convenient and great service”
Reviews.Author: AZSage
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Seattle. It is luxurious, but comfortable. The service was great, from the front desk, to bellman to the restaurant. There are nice conveniences such as free coffee in the AM, and wine hour in the PM by the fireplace lounge. The Sazarec restaurant was very good for lunch, and crowded for dinner. I'd definitely recommend it, as it has a 3 course dinner for $20 or $30. Also, it is about 2 blocks form the light rail that goes to the SeaTac Airport, so instead of paying $50 for a shuttle and getting stuck in traffic, you can pay $2.75 for a nice ride on the rails. It is withing walking distance of the Pike Market, and nightlife off Blanchard St. I was staying for a convention, and got a really low rate, so I can't comment on the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Surfergirl2020
Reviews.Content: We love kimptons and we enjoyed our stay here , but we wish Our dog was with us and that there was a pool or rooftop hot tub.. Wine hour is always great. The rooms were clean and modern but the beds were not so comfy. You are a few blocks away from the fish market and some great restaurants (Go to "list" for happy hour- half off great food and beverages inc. Wine bottles). Make sure you join kimpton rewards!

Reviews.Title: “My recent stay at Hotel Monaco - Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Nic90277
Reviews.Content: I came to Hotel Monaco on a solo trip, only for 2 nights, but had a wonderful experience! The hotel was located in a very easy-to-find location within walking distance of all the popular attractions I wanted to see. The hotel staff was very friendly & helpful and I LOVED my room. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Extra Nice Stay in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Seattle, so I had lots of questions when I made the reservation. The hotel staff was friendly, patient, and very informative - made it easy to decide to stay there. When we arrived, we weren't disappointed. The reception and checkout was smooth. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The robes are a great touch. Enjoyed the wine. The staff at the restaurant was outstanding - good was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “hotel monaco nice stay”
Reviews.Author: losita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in late September. Our stay was quiet, and the room was clean and adequate. I liked the colorful paint schemes. I'm not so sure I like having all the goldfish around the hotel, as I believe that providing live animals as entertainment is never a good idea, as the animal just gets discarded when it's sick or old. Plus, having them in bowls near the elevators for anyone to torment is not such a good idea. On the plus side, the staff was helpful and we liked that it was only a few blocks from Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: B M
Reviews.Content: The many, many extra touches and great staff made our stay in Seattle really memorable. We loved the goldfish and leopard bathrobes! The decor was charming and the room extremely comfortable and clean. We left our baggage with the bellman before check-in and after check-out and were pleased that the staff knew this both times without being asked. Very personal. it was my husband's 50th birthday while we were there and he received champagne and chocolates. The location is perfect for walking around downtown. The food in the restaurant was delicious, and again service was excellent. I completed the survey after our stay and they actually responded! They care . . . and it shows in every detail.

Reviews.Title: “What a place.”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: I loved every momet of my stay. I felt like I was importent. I mattered. From the door man to the frount desk, The man who got our car was sweet and helpful. The rooms were clean and smelled fresh. I cuddle in a chair with a blanket and read a book. I was at home Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “It was comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ItsEmSLC
Reviews.Content: The bed had Frette linens and was comfortable. The sheets had some stains and a hole. The room was large and the bath nice, but there was a constant noise all night long and I couldn't figure out what it was. We were on the top floor so I settled on it being noise from the roof. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay. No view on the back side but I was warned. I wanted a higher level and that was all that was left.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel. Great service. Excellent restaurant and good location.”
Reviews.Author: barbdpayne
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The hotel is small enough to feel personal. The room had personality. It was not a sterile, big-city type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bree B
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED our stay here. Very convenient location, lovely room, and excellent friendly staff. The onsite restaurant Sazerac is to die for, and has a marvelous happy hour! The hotel hosts a "wine hour" at the end of the day, and this was a great way to relax and meet other guests. They will give you a goldfish in a bowl for your room, during your stay, if you request it. I thought that was a really fun twist. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would LOVE to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: willperson
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at Hotel Monaco Seattle middle of September 2011. We have stayed at Kimpton properties and Hotel Monaco (in San Francisco) before. We love the Kimpton group and Hotel Monaco Seattle was outstanding. Service cannot be beat, rooms are very nice, bar and restaurant are good, and downtown location was excellent. I heartily endorse this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here you wont regret it!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Trav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a four season hotel then moved to this hotel. Very clean rooms and friendly serive. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rg2000
Reviews.Content: Actually we are still in our room as I write this review (room 417). The room is meticulously clean, All the staff is very friendly and helpful. I am a stickler for a "super clean room" . This room is definitely up to snuff. The hotel has a free wine happy hour from 5-6 and your car is free to take out as much as you want (daily parking fee). My husband registered for free WiFi through the Kimpton "In Touch Frequent Flyer program". This program also entitles you (at least in seattle at this time) for $10 off the mini bar (if that matters). I would absolutely reccomend this hotel if looking for a hotel in the downtown area. The "W" hoel is a block away as well as the "Four Seasons". This hotel is easily accessible to everything in the downtown area (Pike Market Place, Seattle waterfront). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bathrobes”
Reviews.Author: alixandalain
Reviews.Content: We had a wacky, wonderful night at the Monaco in Seattle. Great service, great bed, yummy breakfast and the best bathrobes ever. We also enjoyed the unusual decor and proximity to the Seattle sites. Would recommend it any time to couples, families or even on your own. Thank you for a great night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel from Aug. 27 through Aug. 31, 2011. We asked for a room that did not accomodate pets, and were given a spacious accomodation on the 11th floor. We were able to take the express elevator. The restaurant was great-we had booked a room with a continental breakfast (croissant, juice and coffee) but were able to get cereal, french toast, eggs etc. for an additional fee. The exercise room and Internet were free of charge. I asked for cups of hot water in the evening and they brought it up to our room within 15 minutes. The front desk staff was very helpful. Four newspapers were available in the lobby for free: The Wall Street Journal, USA Today, The New York Times, and a Seattle newspaper. The location was great. It was close to the waterfront, Pike's Market and shopping. We were able to walk to a nearby hotel to get the bus to Mt. Ranier.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LweinsTheDalles_OR
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel every year for 14 years and always enjoy it. Beautiful property. Great decor. Always super clean. Friendly staff. Centrally located in downtown Seattle. And you can get a goldfish to sleep with you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: SpaceCityGirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the service was excellent, but I probably wouldn't say its a 4 star hotel, as advertized on Expedia. It seemed more like a 3 star to me.
