The main reason was that the rooms were a little outdated, and the bathrooms were just standard. I did like the size of the rooms. We had a deluxe and it was very spacious. Also, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have had in a hotel recently. We slept very well there, no noise in the halls, and the room got super-dark, with the blackout curtains. The pillows were very soft and comfortable too. The location of the hotel is great, very close to all the downtown attractions and the light rail. You don't need to rent a car if you are just hitting the tourist spots in downtown, just take the light rail from the airport for $2.75. One tip that we learned the hard way...when walking east, back to the hotel from the waterfront, use a street like Union or Pike, not on Spring or Seneca, they are very steep and a lot harder to climb up, especially when you're wearing heels.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and good value in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: TravelLight54
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Kimpton Hotels before and the personal, friendly service is consistent regardless of location. The Seattle Monaco was no different. Seattle hotels can be quite expensive in the summer, but the Monaco, while not cheap, was affordable and very well located. We had the entire family with us, so we needed a suite and two rooms. We were all located together, a great convenience. We only used room service once for coffee. The cost of room service everywhere is absurdly high these days. I cannot say it was great value, but it was delivered promptly. Service in the bar downstairs was very hospitable and the evening refreshments were welcome. Finally, the bell staff were great at getting our rather large group in as few taxis as possible and this on a weekend where taxis were at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “A hoot -- very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MM3939
Reviews.Content: We went to Seattle for a weekend of dining and shopping, and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. We were able to walk to all our restaurants, plus the Pike Place Market, and even Uwajimaya, one of our regular stops. The hotel gave us a goldfish named Andrea for the weekend. After two nights I thought Andrea looked hungry, so they gave me a little packet of fish food. The New York Times was delivered to the room every morning except Sunday. The room was clean and quiet. Just as advertised there was a reception in the lobby every afternoon. I can't think of a single thing that went wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BossRino
Reviews.Content: I spent two sleepless nights in this hotel due to the pillows all being hard. I was not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, room, service, food and location!”
Reviews.Author: YankinMelbs
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Kimpton properties and this one did not disappoint. The room was super spacious even with all of our stuff from being on the road for five weeks. Super cozy bed and there was even a little walking/running guide for guests. The location is great as it is easy walking distance to all you want to see and do yet not right in the middle of it all so it stays relaxing/peaceful. We booked on line months in advance as we were traveling from overseas for a long holiday and got such a low rate for 4 nights for a total steal. I will definitely stay here again if I'm ever back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: RPS10
Reviews.Content: We couldn't say enough about our stay at this hotel. Our kids loved it! The goldfish in the room was a big hit, as were the free milk and cookies, free toy chest, and free movie! They got a kick out of the animal print bathrobes. While not being a "kid hotel", they make kids feel very special. From an adult perspective, the lobby is beautiful, the rooms are nicely done and clean, the staff is great, the complimentary wine hour is a nice touch, the attached restaurant was great, and the location is awesome. Bravo--Kimpton has figured it out!

Reviews.Title: “nicely decorated spacious room”
Reviews.Author: frunypie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 5 nights in August. The location is good. It is walking distance to Pike Place market and the monorail and there are a few good restaurants nearby. It does get a little quiet on the weekends however as it is in the financial district and we found that most places did close early making it a little diffucult to get a snack or coffee outside the hotel in the late evening. The room was very spacious making it great for us: a couple and two young children. That said, the sofa bed would have been extremely uncomfortable for an adult, but the kids did not complain at all. And it was nice to have a heavy curtain separating the space, so we could have a light on while the kids were sleeping. The welcome package for the kids was nice as was the box of toys in the lobby. We did not get a goldfish for the first few days (due to some heat wave... not sure if that was just a cute excuse for the kids or the truth) but did finally get one after a few days of nagging. Not a big deal, but I would rather they didn't advertise it unless it can be guaranteed upon arrival. The restaurant was great: we ate there twice and had two great meals.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again, loved the staff, a little sad for fish alone in small bowl”
Reviews.Author: elizabethColorado00
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Monaco from the front desk, to the waiters in the fabulous restaurant each morning to the housecleaning were incredibly kind and helpful. The hotel is located in a great location close enough to walk along the water and close enough to walk to the convention center. It is also safe at night, which I appreciated. I love all animals and adore the "idea" of having gold fish for guests, but for a slightly extra investment for a larger bowl, two fish could hang together. It is difficult enough for fish without pumped in air supply, but to be completely alone (especially gold fish which can easily live together) at least doesn't make it look so lonely. Two different people I brought to my room commented on how lonely the fish in the hall looked. Otherwise it's a fabulous place!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: psucutie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a cruise. Hotel was wonderful. Front desk was able to check us in right away. Lovely location, gym was fine. Happy hour each night was a fun perk. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great restaurant and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: kroper777
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 20 month old daughter and I stayed here for three nights and had a wonderful time! All of the staff was wonderful and accomodated all of our requests immediately! Our daughter loved the fish 'Lucia' that we had in our room. It was a fun touch! We also ate at the restaurant in the lobby twice and the food was excellent! The room service was a little over priced, but we only ordered dessert. The location was great as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go in Seattle. The valet parking was a little pricey, but they were very accomodating and even ran to our car to grab our sunglasses for us. Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! Great military/government rates for those that qualify!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Night Sleep, Seattle is Expensive”
Reviews.Author: PaulandMichelle01
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice room in Seattle in the summer you'll pay for it but this place is worth it. Very knowledgable and accomodating staff. Extremely comfortable bed with very nice linens. I'd come back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! The whole package!”
Reviews.Author: Butt0r
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times on business and pleasure. Everytime is amazing. The staff is always friendly and accommodating and the rooms are great. Free WiFi in the room for intouch members (sign up for free). The staff and environment always makes me feel like I'm in luxury, but without any snootyness or snobery. Plus...every night at 5pm they have wine hour which makes for a perfect starter to the evening events :) I have also stayed here with my 3yr old son and this place is great for kids. They greet him with a little plush toy upon entering and always have his kids leopard print robe ready next to mine. To top it all off, they give him a pet goldfish in the room that he always gets a kick out of.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: drwho304
Reviews.Content: As usual the Kimpton chain is wonderful place to stay. Rooms are just the right size with the best of amenities. Evening wine reception is a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: vvatx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we spent the night in Seattle on our way to Alaska via Holland America cruiselines. Its in a great location downtown and offered us a great experience into Seattle on our first ever visit there. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about service”
Reviews.Author: Rettech
Reviews.Content: From the moment our car pulled up to the sidewalk, to the check in which took less than one minute, service at this hotel was something sweet. Room was comfortable and nice, great amenities, excellent room service breakfast without having to go to an ATM machine or getting a mortgage on the house, this place is a great value. Close to downtown shopping and restaurants. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rmil342
Reviews.Content: This was by far the greatest hotel we had stayed at! We regret only staying there one night, we wish we could have stayed longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Consistent quality and service”
Reviews.Author: Trebor-K
Reviews.Content: I stay here on business, once a month for 5 days at a time. Always a pleasure and NO hassle!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Travellover
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel for business or personal travel. They had to replace the phone in my room and delivered a box of chocolates to apologize. Also love that Kimpton in touch program gives you a $10 minibar credit and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaBettie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire at a rate of $120 per night. Check-in was smooth, bathroom and linens were clean, hallways were quiet and the staff was helpful and friendly. The only thing I didn't like was having a goldfish in the room because they're in such small bowls. Didn't use any services as we only stayed the one night. Am staying there again next month!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Very clean and well-appointed. The rates are super reasonable. Overall, this chain of hotels (Kimpton) really delivers. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: BinnyB
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Wonderful service. Comfortable clean quiet rooms. Great location for exploring Seattle highlights. Don't miss the wine at 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: bloomingidiot
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 6 nights with 3 adult children (2 rooms) for vacation. I can not think of anything I did not like about this place. Conveniently located to practically everything, we were able to walk everywhere, including the Amtrak station to catch our train. All the employees were friendly and helpful, especially the turn down service woman. Routinely coming to the room after our east coast time zone bodies were past ready for bed, she eagerly gave us plenty of chocolates and left us alone! Get a goldfish delivered to your room, even if you think it's silly. You'll be amazed how attached you can get to a goldfish! The rooms are spacious (we had a king suite and a queen) with plenty of places to sit besides just the bed. The beds are comfortable, clean, and the water pressure in the shower is amazing! I love the full size shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel pump bottles in the shower. Not having to fumble with tiny bottles and caps is nice. We never seemed to be around for the wine reception (so much to do!), but did have breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant and it was very good. The value of the rooms, especially with the AAA rate, was excellent. I've stayed in many hotels not nearly as nice for more money. I will not hesitate to stay here again if I am in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: mcunnin777
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about the Monaco. We spent 2 night there before we went on an Alaskan cruise. The hotel is a short walk from the Pike St. Market and just a few blocks in the orher direction from the Ferry Terminal. The rooms are clean and spacious and the service is excellent. They have a complimentary wine tasting in the lobby every evening and you can even get a goldfish delivered to your room to keep you company if you like. The Sazarac Restauraunt is located on the first floor. The food and service is decent and they have a nice happy hour with inexpensive appitizers. I would say if you are flying into Seattle don't bother with a rental car. Valet parking at the Monaco is $35 per night. Take a shuttle in from the airport. The city has a good public transportation system, the busses downtown are free, and cabs are easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: KrisinKennewick
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were wonderful! Hotel was clean--the room & most importantly, the bathroom, were very clean! The free wine reception hour was wonderful! The hotel is close to Pike Place Market, famous Post Alley, and wonderful shopping (Nordstrom, Tiffany & Co., Macy's, etc., etc.) and is in a very safe part of town--walking around, even later at night, wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: ElRa09
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are a bit dated, the hotel overall was very nice. In a good location downtown just a few block from Pike Place.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful with our wedding block!”
Reviews.Author: srd7911
Reviews.Content: Working with Hotel Monaco was fantastic, Ariela was amazingly helpful with changes and altering the block of rooms and the dates of everyone coming into town. While at the hotel, the staff was super helpful and incredibly friendly. The rooms were comfortable and beautiful. We would recommend them highly for working to make your event wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: likes2laugh2
Reviews.Content: With my two kids in tow, I walked up to the front desk to try and see if I could check in early. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to but the front desk clerk was so courteous and helpful I am glad I wasn't. He pointed out many areas of interest within walking distance of the hotel, and then called me personally when our room was ready. He also gave my little guy a free movie credit for the night. Room service food was exceptional as well, and seriously, I wish I could have stayed my entire trip there. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel -- but too expensive”
Reviews.Author: deej713
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton Hotels, but I do think that their room rates were too pricey for what they offered ($250.00). The rooms were very small -- almost like a large walk-in closet. The gym downstairs was cramped, as well, with just a couple of cardio machines. They do have an agreement with Gold's Gym where guests can use Gold's during their stay with Hotel Monaco, but be prepared to hike a few blocks down the street. They offer free wi-fi, which is good. They also had a cocktail hour in the lobby at 5 pm at which they serve beer, wine, sangria and other non-alcoholic bevs, in addition to some finger food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: We took a ten month and three year old and the hotel is chic yet kid friendly. Toy box with free toy upon check in and kids welcome bag help. About four blocks from Pike's place so an easy walk. We got a fish in our room to watch during our stay and there was a DVD player which came in handy. As usual of kimpton there was a helpful and amazing staff

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendy!”
Reviews.Author: HilzDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel and the front desk staff were very welcoming and informative. They had a nice selection of little toys for the children to choose from when we got there and the kids also loved their pet fish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kimpton experience”
Reviews.Author: Lalama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 4 nights while exploring downtown Seattle and the tourist attractions before taking a cruise. We love the fun, quirky extras that Kimptons provide...My daughters really got a kick out of our goldfish, Dave. :-) The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and the atmosphere was lovely. The location, in the financial district, may not have been ideal for a family vacation, but everything we wanted to do was within walking distance or easily accessible by public transportation. The in-hotel restaurant caters more to an adult, hip crowd, rather than being family-friendly, but there are plenty of choices in downtown Seattle, and not enough time to enjoy them all! Wi-fi is available for free for Kimpton In Touch members- free to join, and a daily newspaper and coupon for the mini-bar were included, too. Kimpton seems to really make an effort to cater to all types of travelers- business, family, singles....the effort is appreciated and we'll stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting amenities...”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: I appreciate Kimpton Hotels. They're all a bit quirky (Monaco delivers a gold fish to your room upon request) with very stylized, current decor, activities for guests (an afternoon wine tasting the day of our visit) and a welcoming attitude towards pets. I don't have any pets, but I imagine it's nice for those who do. The service is casual and low profile, responding rapidly to all requests but not going out of their way to offer assistance. My biggest gripe would probably be the pricey and attractive sundries scattered around the room (at checkout my incidentals totaled $173.84). Ooh, I nearly forgot to mention it, but they have leopard and zebra and cheetah print bathrobes that are pretty neat.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service, and dogs are pampered too”
Reviews.Author: Oakland_DAD_83
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Like all Kimpton properties, they went out of their way to make us AND OUR DOGS feel welcomed. We'd stay there again anytime we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: geo60750
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, top notch service and a great location. Walking distance from everything that you need to see in Seattle. Great hotel. Great city and you dont need a loan from your bank to pay for it. Reasonable priced. George

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, and great perks!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugSpokane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this hotel - it is walking distance to both the Market and Safeco Field. The wine social is more like a party in the lobby with games, a fortune teller, a piano player, and all the wine/beer you can drink in an hour. And the staff is always friendly and helpful. This hotel is also pet-friendly with a resident dog that greets you in the lobby. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: megs828
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night after returning from a cruise. The hotel was conveniently located downtown, only a short walk from Pike Place Market. The Space Needle was about a mile walk, and you can take the monorail to shorten the walk. Very friendly, helpful service at the hotel, especially the bellhops. The room was nice and clean. My only complaint was the room doors which were older and noisy when people shut them, which woke me up a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ben_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: It's the staff that makes this hotel special. They were incredibly helpful and friendly. The rooms are nice, though as other reviewers state, vary quite a bit. Avoid the x14 rooms if at all possible--we were in 814, which was much smaller than the other rooms, and also had a loud banging noise recurring throughout the day. Luckily, this didn't affect our sleep (I don't think, anyway). The restaurant attached to the lobby (Sazerac) is great, and the service there was outstanding as well--they even will give you coffee in the morning when it runs out in the lobby (which it did every morning we were there, about an hour before the end of coffee service). The location is incredibly convenient, in walking distance of basically everything you'd want to see (though my wife and I are walkers and have no problem walking a mile to get somewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Take the staff and clone them!”
Reviews.Author: sealiz
Reviews.Content: Wow. What an amazing staff at this hotel. I believe a room is a room and all hotels will sell you a room. What makes a big difference to me is the service provided to you at the hotel. The Hotel Monaco in Seattle has SUPERB service. Truly. The staff is beyond outstanding. Nothing is too big of a deal for the staff at this hotel. It is easy to say "oh well that's just good customer service - but the staff at this hotel gives EXTRAORDINARY customer service to every individual. Example: during the wine reception the staff not only had wine available, but had fresh sangria and water. The staff not only poured what you wanted, but offered other things e.g., pass around appetizers one night, happy hour suggestions, would make dinner reservations while you were drinking wine, etc. The concierge at this hotel was amazing as well! If you have an issue they take care of it IMMEDIATELY (I had an issue with the restaurant twice and the hotel staff was so nice about trying to fix what had gone wrong). I even had the opportunity to meet the General Manager - Mr. Tom - after meeting and talking with him for a bit it was really obvious to see why the hotel staff was so extraordinary. A room is a room, but if you are visiting Seattle, this hotel makes you want to never leave!

Reviews.Title: “That rare combination of luxury facilities and down-to-earth service”
Reviews.Author: kiwimusume
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near the heart of Seattle’s shopping district. The staff were extremely helpful, with one of the staff at the concierge desk Googling the weather the night before a tour I had booked. The room was extremely comfortable and spacious, and their restaurant was great. Room service food was average, but the staff member who delivered it was very friendly. The hotel also hosted the convention I was there for. The staff handled it amazingly and were very friendly throughout the whole process, even though it must have been pretty stressful to coordinate. The food was also amazing – I am in love with the apple pastries they served for breakfast and wish I could have taken some home. I was travelling on my own but couldn’t help noticing their kid- and pet-friendly policies. Pets are allowed, and their names are written on a blackboard. Kids can also get a goldfish to keep as a pet while they’re there. The hotel puts a very strong emphasis on friendly, personalised service, and it comes through in everything they do. It is very rare in my experience to find a hotel that has luxury facilities but is down-to-earth in the way they treat their guests. I have been told that the entire hotel chain (Kimpton Hotels) aims to be like this, so I will definitely be checking out other hotels from that chain the next time I go to the US.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sassy_og
Reviews.Content: Went to Seattle for the weekend and stayed at Hotel Monaco. Location was great. Staff very friendly & helpful. Good place to take kids. They had a welcome bag for our little guy upon arrival and a gold fish named "Karen" in our room. He loved it! The hotel decor was great! Very oppulent. We stayed in the Monte Carlo suite. It was spacious and comfortable. We chose the suite so that we could relax without disturbing our son once he went to sleep. The two rooms are seperated by a big curtain. It worked. Was not soundproof but baby did not wake up, so it served its purpose. Turn down service in the evening & choclates in the room. On the flip side there were a few things: the hotel plumbing was very noisy. Everytime someone ran water/ flushed a toilet you could hear the pipes in the walls screaming away. the hotel taxes were really high. $50/night on a $340/night room. (included continentail breakfast with this price. Breakfast was good. But quite small (coffee, oj & croissant) Lack of hot water when showering. I had a bath 1 night & a shower another time. Both times I was only able to have a luke warm temperature. Not the case for my husbands showers. They were hot. Perhpas it was bad timing, but that isn't something I expect from a hotel as usually the hot water is limitless. Overall, I would stay again at this hotel. The negatives were minor and the plus' were great!

Reviews.Title: “Good position, unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MCC3303
Reviews.Content: My favourite city on our trip. Monaco was very clean and room comfortable. Position excellent but just out of the way of noisy city traffic. Reception polite and helpful. IGA - two blocks away. Starbucks next door - good for a quick on the run breakfast and coffee. Shopping, restaurants and attractions close by. Seattle is easy to navigate. Walking tours excellent. Free tea and coffee each morning from 6am. Great sitting areas in the foyer - very homely, warm and inviting. Large gym downstairs. Ate at Cheesecake factory - good value, Italian Restaurant - Pink Door - fresh pasta.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, comfy bed, central to downtown Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: embargo
Reviews.Content: The location is nice and rooms are spacious. Even though the hotel allows pets the rooms nor the hotel didn't have pet order. The restaurant in the hotel has good pizza and that's about it. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Superior service!”
Reviews.Author: JReilly85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was immaculate and the service from the front desk was superior. Every single question was answered with patience, courtesy and enthusiasm. The room was beautiful, the bed the most comfortable hotel bed we've ever slept in, the water pressure excellent and there was plenty of surface area in the bathroom to hold our travel supplies for the week. The best part was the location of the hotel: we could walk or take the bus to any place in town easily and conveniently. We will stay there the next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 13traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, 10PM, but felt immediately at ease with the hospitable welcome from the front desk. The hotel is centrally located to everything - Pike Market, convention center, downtown shopping, pier, and right next door to the most architecturally interesting library that I have seen. It's been a while since I've been to a Hotel Monaco, but this visit made me want to book another Hotel Monaco at my next destination. The hotel has a modern hip feel to it. It's clean, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissJennb
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels. This one was very well located. Easy walk to everything I wanted to see and do. The staff was very nice, very helpful. From the valets to the desk staff, everyone was friendly and helpful at every opportunity. We received some excellent dining recommendations from them. The first night, we arrived late and went to a place the front desk staff suggested many places and even marked them all on a map so we could easily find them. A few tips though. The standard rooms are small, but this is normal in city hotels. I was not bothered by it but for an extended stay, I would book a larger room in the same hotel. The architecture is lovely. The lobby is decorated with cute artwork all the way to the ceiling. The hotel has the standard Kimpton wine reception but this one also offered sangria (very good) and Xbox games in the lobby. Very fun. I also very much enjoyed the restaurant. We received some free glass of wine vouchers because we arrived after the daily wine reception and the staff is just nice. So when we went to cash them in, the menu tempted us and we really enjoyed it. We sat at a large, comfy booth and relaxed over dinner and many glasses of wine. It's a busy hotel but it doesn't feel like it. I was never bothered by noise, never had to wait for desk service, valet, anything for more than a minute or two. I did fill out a survey and noted that the only flaw I found was a spot in the room where someone had been a little mean to the carpet. The manager took the time to write me and thank me for my review and also to let me know that the carpet would be repaired soon as a renovation was coming. I'll definitely check this hotel out again after the renovation. I like Kimpton's style so I'm curious to see how it turns out. Great to have someone actually respond to my review though. Great hotel. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel - so different - great central location”
Reviews.Author: CY83
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. It is so different - really cool. Right from the beginning the reception desk was very good and gave us a lot of information, the rest of the staff was also superb. The interior is amazing. We requested a cute gold fish to our room. We did not have to feed it or anything but it is really cool. The complimentary wine in the evening was also very good. Unfortunately, we did not have enough time to really enjoy all the amenities of this cool, extraordinary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cwheelh1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Alaska cruise. It is a great hotel and very family friendly. The location is a few blocks from Pike's Market and about a 20 min walk or so from the Space Needle. The staff was very friendly. They allowed us to store our luggage while we did some sightseeing and even called when our room was ready. PS - only negative is that the restaurant was pricey for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to stay”
Reviews.Author: RMTCA
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here mid-June. I cannot think of a better place to stay- location is ideal. Several blocks to the waterfront, several blocks to the monorail, Pikes, shopping. A short cab to Safeco. Very attentive to my entire family. Also looked like a good place to stay for the business traveler too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience with sincerely caring staff at Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Neil S
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary last month and had a great time at the Hotel Monaco. The rooms were pleasantly decorated and of quite decent size. The bathrooms were tastefully designed and the towels were nice. The bed was comfortable. Really a very nice hotel-but if you really want a workout facility and pool onsite, you'll need to look elsewhere. All of the staff were believably sincere and pleasant-from the valet attendant to the front desk. The complimentary Prosecco was of considerable quality, as were the Seattle chocolates. This was my first time at this property, and we found it to very likable. We didn't make it to the wine tasting, which is too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TammyRW
Reviews.Content: Excellent decor, very welcoming,friendly and helpful staff. Sazarac restaurant was great for lunch and happy hour! Decor and ambience very appealing. Location great for walking to all the downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: Moriah75
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff at Hotel Monaco was amazing, my husband wanted a very specific t-shirt from Seattle and the staff member made several calls to track it down for me. We also got excellent advice on locations to visit, places to eat and places to see while in Seattle. Overall, the hotel was very clean and well appointed and we had an excellent view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “it's the little things that matter”
Reviews.Author: winstongal72
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at this Kimpton property many times over the past several years as I often travel to Seattle on business. I am always impressed with the staff - friendly faces, willingness to help under any circumstances - to be quite honest, the people are what keep me coming back. During my most recent stay here's a sample of what I experienced. As a member of the InTouch program, upon check-in I was assured that all of my preferences had been taken care of (extra towels, the Wall St. Journal each morning) but also received a gift certificate for $20 off any refreshments in my room, just for being a return guest! Within about 10 minutes of getting settled in my room, the phone rang. The front desk was just checking in to make sure that my room was comfortable and to offer any further assistance personally if I might need something. Perhaps one of the best moments was for nightly turn down service. When I opened the door, I was greeted with the most genuine smile I've seen in any of my travels. She offered me the complimentary chocolates, even some extra ones, and then said, "Enjoy your evening my sweet sister." From the "Welcome back" each night from the bell staff, to the kindness of the housekeeping staff, it's the little touches that make the Monaco one of my favorite places in Seattle to stay. I'm a sucker for a comfortable bed and soft sheets but it's the service that makes it a pleasure to be a guest of this hotel. I refer many of my colleagues and will continue to do so, all because I feel that the folks of this hotel truly appreciate my business.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: haringdr27
Reviews.Content: We stated her 2 nights for Seattle sightseeing. The hotel is close to Pikes Market and about a half hour walk to the Space Needle and to the waterfront. An easy walk and we strollered a one year old no problem. Seattles Best and StarBucks at each corner. The hotel was very clean, well kept, the room was great and the bathrrom good also. The bed was super comfortable. Bathrobes in the closet, we felt special for awhile. The staff was really nice. No pool and wifi you had to pay for. I hate hotels that make you pay for wifi, just another way to get that extra buck from the guest. Parking was expensive and I curbside parked right outside the hotel for free on the weekend and holiday. Overall a nice stay but super expensive and I would have stayed elsewhere for less extravaganza at a lower rate. I recommend this hotel for the bsiness traveler or if you have extra bucks and want a fancy smancy hotel. In downtown Seattle parking and hotels are expensive and this hotel fit that Billing.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but not remarkable”
Reviews.Author: sdmike48
Reviews.Content: Small cramped rooms, lackluster service, great location add up to 3 stars. There for a business meeting I found the restaurants unaccommodating. I guess they're hip, but the idea of sitting on an ottoman and eating off a low table just didn't appeal to me. Waiter didn't offer any other options as the restaurant was short staffed on a sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “Short of other Kimpton hotels, stay at the W across the street”
Reviews.Author: ifprod
Reviews.Content: Room was never cleaned, needed to request from front desk. Housekeeping woke us up on the day of check out. Overall, hotel was short of my typical Kimpton experience -- very disappointing. Just stay across the street at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: cbielski
Reviews.Content: Great service. Good room - not the best I have ever stayed in, but nice. Located in Seattle in a place downtown that is pretty much central to everything. Good value. As far as I can tell, there aren't any great views of the water, but there are some not-so-great views you could avoid, if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Fish”
Reviews.Author: Tracci
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel with a great Location. You can request to get a gold fish in your room, which is not important but it's a nice touch to have in your room. There is also free wine in the lobby from 5-6pm. The location is great for walking around downtown also. I will stay here again in fact I am staying at another Kimpton hotel in Seattle in September and I can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Great at the time, disappointed now.”
Reviews.Author: Asherzmom
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel. Staff - amazing. Room - amazing. Location - perfect. Paid completely up front for four nights at this hotel over New Years. Came home to find a mystery charge from the hotel. When I called the hotel, not even they could explain it, could not FIND it, and told me to DISPUTE it. Several months later, I was told this was a room no show charge. Hard to believe we'd no show for ONE night during our prepaid FOUR night stay. We are still fighting with the hotel. This has really left a bad taste in our mouths for this place which we were dying to get back to. Our credit card had to be closed out, and we are still fighting this charge which no one at the hotel can explain other than saying it was for a now show (did I mention we were there in another room at the time). Just plain frustrated and worn out....

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Trish2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nites at this hotel. We had a Suite and it was beautiful. It was my mothers 69th birthday and the staff really went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and welcoming. They sent up a bottle of champagne and fruit as a gift for her. It was wonderful! Since we traveled by train and the hours were not exactly in line with check in/out they allowed us to have early check in and late check out. I would stay at this hotel every time I visit Seattle. Beautiful and the best staff anywhere ever!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: tvigeant
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Monaco Seattle Hotel, and loved it. It was our 25th anniversary and we wanted to spend a few days in Seattle before our cruise left for Alaska. A trip we have dreamed about for 25 years. I booked the hotel through Priceline and got a really good rate. Once I saw that it was a Kimpton Hotel I went online and joined the Kimpton Frequent Traveler club. I let them know that it was a special occassion for us. They automatically upgraded our room and have Champagne and a fruit basket delivered upon our arrival. It was magical. I have traveled a lot for business, but have never experienced a hotel where every single staff person was so hospitable. I don't know how they do it. They are very welcoming. The bathroom was honestly the cleanest I have ever seen. And, the staff were flawless. We were within walking distance to everything in the city, including the Pkie Place Market. Lots of fun. Make sure to visit the Pier 55 and have a stroll along the waterfront. I would definately stay there again, and I will certainly look for a Kimpton Hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Nice Location, Funky Decor”
Reviews.Author: Cepage
Reviews.Content: First, I had very excellent service, with a gracious reception and a late check out the next day. The hotel location is very good for walking in Seattle. The hotel building is a bit old but has been refurbished, I'd imagine a number of times and probably has been a hotel under at least several names over the years. It is definitely a top class place. I had no problems at all with the internet connection. If contemplating staying here, you should register for the loyalty program, In-Touch, which will give you use of the internet for free. I used the ethernet cable that was in my room so I did not try to connect to the WiFi, but I'd assume it works also. The In-Touch program also gives you $10 credit towards the mini-bar and snacks in the room, however that $10 will not go very far . . . . My one negative comment would be that the machines in gym were somewhat old, albeit in decent condition, and there was only 1 treadmill. There were 3 stair climbing/elliptical machines, however, plus a stationary bicycle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & unique hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: dcbased08
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff at this hotel. Lots of character and fun little perks/touches, just like the other Hotel Monaco locations nationwide. Join their rewards program ahead of time to get free wireless internet and a $10 "raid the minibar" coupon. There's also a free wine reception in the lobby from 5pm-7pm daily. Easy, clean business center and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel with a Great Heart"”
Reviews.Author: 82Dave
Reviews.Content: Just spent three days in Seattle and we picked the Hotel Monaco based on location to our meetings and experience from other Komptons Hotels on east coast. This was a great stay and the best part ended up being the Hotel employees. Not just front desk or the door man, but everytime a housekeeping or maintanence person saw us we were greeted with a smile, a hello and even would walk over a press the button to summons the elevator to our floor. I am always impressed when all parts of a hotel are interesting, fun, clean and the people are happy to have you stay with them. The hotel lobby and the unique display of one of a kind chandelers is worth seeing. Restaurant was a very nice find with great happy hour and very friendly atmosphere.. I will go back and next time to enjoy and relax.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Germanix
Reviews.Content: After New Years Day 2011 it's the second time we have choosen Hote Monaco. Its friendly and caring staff as all the facilities and amenities are second to none in its class. Surely the best for tourists and business visitors is the hotel's central location in walking distance to the train station, the ferries and cruise-ships, great shops and many tourist attractions (MonoRail to Space-Needle, Pike Place Market, Pioneer Place, Smith Tower, China-Town, etc.). We're looking forward to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “We needed peace and quiet and we found heaven at Hotel Monaco.”
Reviews.Author: unterspan
Reviews.Content: Needing a short get-a-way we decided to try seattle- a drive for us and we discovered two hotels on the internet that seemed right. The Edgewater and the Hotel Monaco. The Edgewater had a view and a fireplace, the Monaco had larger rooms and a deep soaking tub with jets. We are so glad we chose the Monaco. The room was huge and even though the window faced an air shaft- with little sun and great interior decorating, who needed to see outside. Every little touch was perfect. From Bryon at the desk agreeing to let us take a lobby easy chair so we could have two comfy chairs in our room, to the amazing decor of the room we were give. Feather pillows , a great duvet and a throw blanket for getting cozy while you read or watch TV. Plus they have a free program which - if you register for it- gives you permission to raid the mini fridge, use internet for free, get 20% off dinner and $30 off a massage. And who needed a massage when you have a deep Japanese soaking tub to climb into after walking those hills to Pike Place Market? So many touches are to make the experience particular to you. what kind of pillow do you want? which paper? The goodies basket even included condoms and a lubricant if needed. Everu hotel should provide that. Way To Go Kimpton!!! you can even bring your pet and if you don't have one they give you a goldfish in a bowl. The hotel restaurant is far above hotel food. Sazerac had an amazing ricotta gnocchi and beet salad that was to die for and the dessert- pecan maple flan with caramelized bananas was fantastic. Hotel Monaco is located in downtown on a main N-S bus line in the free zone. the central library is across the street- cafes and amazing ethnic food surround you and so you can eat cheap and great within a walk from the hotel. Wine is served everyday at 5 and coffee/tea awaits you in the morning. Ironically one of my favorite places to eat is in Portland's Hotel Monaco- Gracie's - you feel as though you are in the St Regis. Stayin at the Hotel Monaco has made a Kimpton fan out of me and from now on that will be my first choice in picking a hotel. Thanks to everyone there we had the get-a-way we really wanted and needed.

Reviews.Title: “Unique experience without snobbery.”
Reviews.Author: MelindaMom
Reviews.Content: First I admit, I'm a huge Kimpton fan. They just have such a fresh approach, and they have a handle on how to make guests feel special. The Kimpton rewards program (called InTouch) is worth joining. They have a great wine hour along with a non-alcoholic selection for those so inclined as well as for the kiddies. The loaner program of a pet goldfish also was a huge hit. The room decor is trendy and unique. This is the third city where we've stayed at a Kimpton, and our family will seek them out wherever we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: boboko
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with friendly and efficien staff. Excellent service from reception, housekeeping to room services. Smooth and clean linen and beddings. A great place for a relaxing stay. Will sure come back!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: vpiscitello
Reviews.Content: I'm relocating to Seattle and am currently looking for apartments. While I was looking for a place to live, I chanced across Hotel Monaco and took up residence there for eight days. From the moment I was met at the valet on the first day to the day they handed the keys back to me, I enjoyed every aspect of the stay. Every member of the staff made me feel not only like a valued customer but that they genuinely cared about my comfort. I have stayed in many fine hotels in the past and have experienced great customer service but not really at this level. Upon check-in, I was informed on how best to take advantage of my stay and ways to save money. After having enrolled in their rewards program, they upgraded me to a suite. The room was more than tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The turn down service left two chocolates on the pillow and if I timed it right, they would cut me in a couple more ;-) The restaurant, Sazerac is not a name you will remember but you certainly will remember the experience. The only complaint is that it was so well liked, the place was packed by 5:30pm. Breakfast was just as good as dinner and reasonably priced (as far as breakfasts go for four star hotels). And the relationship was tested as well: Upon check out, I had learned that I had been charged for a bottle of wine I had not consumed. I figured that it was due to a bottle I had brought in and left out on the table. Simple mistake and simply explained. But I did wonder how this would be dealt with. No problem. I explained that I did not drink the bottle of wine and that they were welcome to run inventory and if it was missing they could put it on my tab. No need. They took my word for it and took it off the tab on the spot. Simple thing. Big relief. I've had simpler things ruin a stay. I will be staying there again and highly recommend that if you are in Seattle, you try the Monaco as well.

Reviews.Title: “Neat hotel, loved the atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: bglodde
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool hotel with great attention to detail. The rooms are comfortable and have every base covered with a stocked mini-fridge, munchies available in the room, and cool robes hanging in the closet. The only drawback is parking, but that is a common for anything downtown. They have a valet service, which was about 40/night. The wireless internet can be purchased for 10/day or free (unusual in the downtown area) if you're willing to sign up to their list. I would highly recommend staying here and hope to do so again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but no internet”
Reviews.Author: tahoegrebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights with two children ages 5 and 7. Visiting Seattle for a sightseeing adventure. Hotel is located in the financial district across from the spectacular Seattle Library. It is a quick five minute walk from the Monorail and Pikes Market. The room was clean and quiet. We loved our goldfish and appreciated the kind attitude the staff had toward our kids. The cleaning staff was extremely thoughtful and friendly. The concierge was somewhat condescending and not 100% knowledgeable of the area. We asked if there was a spot to get ice cream and were told, "Seattle is not that kind of city". The next day we stumbled across a gelato shop two blocks away. There are several higher end restaurants, but if you want some mom and pop local flare within walking distance, they cater to the business lunch crowd and close at five. Unfortunately, we won't be returning because the "free internet" you get with the Kipton program did not work. I had a big work deadline and needed to upload a file. The transmit rate was 0. The front desk staff told me to call IT. I spent 30 minutes talking to them with no luck. Finally I packed up and headed to Starbucks next door, but they closed at 6 p.m. Very frustrating and a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: drose12
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but was very impressed with the service. I love good service. Front desk was friendly and helpful, as were the door men. We had happy hour in the bar Food was innovative, good and quick. Told the wait would be 20 minutes, went up to our room, came back down and maitre'd spotted us and lead us to a nice couch. Finished in time to attend a show at Jazz Alley. Nice job Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dhuds0n
Reviews.Content: I try many different hotels wherever I travel but I do often return to ones that I really like. The Hotel Monaco, Seattle is one I return to. It has an eccelctic flavour with layers of pattern and colour often not seen in hotels who are always trying to appeal to everyone. The service is always excellent and the lobby is set up so that there are many intimate, people-watching spots to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are great, but hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Z00tie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, just a few blocks away from Pike Market. We got a great deal on Hotwire and were pleasantly surprised. However, the decor needs updating and its a little worn - if you like decor of every colour and pattern imaginable with leopard print robes then this is the place for you, for me its a bit kitsch and out of date. The parking was a BIG detractor - its valet parking only and whilst its great to have your car valeted its over $50 a day because of the 'parking tax'. I have never had my car valeted as I don't think its really worth it, but there really aren't any easy parking alternatives! So in summary, really helpful staff and great downtown location, but I wouldn't pay alot to stay here and if you have your car, be prepared to fork out

Reviews.Title: “High quality small hotel”
Reviews.Author: fireman-175
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found they only had us for one night. No problem, they extended it at the same price as the first night. Lobby, elevators, and hallways are very clean and smelled fresh. Elevators are pretty quick and we did not wait more than a minute for one from the 7th floor. Room appeared clean. Beds were comfortable, but pillows were very fluffy and firm. Kind of odd. They brought up two kids bathrobes, which were such a hit. Bathrooms were clean and tub had no mildew. Good water pressure. Phones are a bit dated. You have to push too many buttons to get a service. Quiet, but plumbing pipes are old and can be noisy in the middle of the night. HVAC system was probably the best and quietest I have every seen. Friday night was their 30th anniversary, as was it our Anniversary. They had a two hour wine fest with cupcakes, free snacks, etc. Not stingy on the wine either! Front desk gave us free DVDs to watch. Oh, kids loved the Guitar Hero during out wine social hour. I recommend they do that again. Valet guys were fast and observant of our needs. Parking is high, but along the rates of local parking fees anyway. We just got over it, but it did add to the cost of our vacation. Fun restaurant adjacent to the hotel. Would have been a 5 star, but no pool.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sds5
Reviews.Content: Such lovely decor, friendly staff, every creature comfort and dog friendly!!! We were so pleasantly surprised by this beautiful hotel. The staff were amazing and nothing was too much trouble. Including our dog on this trip was a great bonus ~ she had all the comforts of home too! The restaurant was fantastic (but a little pricey) and the decor was really unique. We will make this our regular hotel in Seattle!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cookie35539
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at the Hotel Monaco in March, 2011. The staff was wonderful, food great and everyone very helpful and pleasant. Highly recommend this hotel - and don't forget to ask for your live gold fish for your room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Personalized Stay”
Reviews.Author: landmmayberry
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a two night get-away for my husband and I, and the staff made it perfect. Upon arrival we were greeted at our car and two of the staff opened the lobby doors to welcome us into the hotel. Check-in was quick, and since my husband is a Kimpton In Touch member we were upgraded to a Monte Carlo Suite, also free wifi, free newspaper and $10 credit for snacks. We were a bit early for our room so we had a late lunch at Sazerac, the restaurant adjoining the hotel. Went with the staff suggestion of drink and Ahi tuna sandwich and both were excellent. Upon finishing our lunch the desk called us to tell us they were ready and we headed up to our room. Just as we had requested we had a higher floor with a King bed. The suite was two rooms divided by a curtain and looked exactly as their hotel pictures show, including a couch, fridge, 2 tv's, bathroom with tub/shower, desk, two wing back chairs, and all decorated in bright stripes and prints..Just makes you want to smile! Large bathroom and animal print robes to use as well. Both the room and bathroom were clean and well kept. Bed was comfortable. Turn down service was available. Free wine tasting every evening in the lobby. They knew it was my husbands birthday because he was an In-Touch member, and to our surprise they delivered chocolates and wine to our room! Just 3-4 blocks to shopping and 7 blocks to Pike Street Market or movie theater. Staff seemed to genuinely care that we had a pleasant stay. We won't stay anywhere else when we next visit Seattle. You've won my heart Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel in good location but parking was expensive”
Reviews.Author: dlbintheoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in March 2011. We enjoyed the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. We like the free wine tasting. The room was comfortable but a bit small. The staff did an excellent job of accommodating our request for a view. We had a view South down 4th Street. I do not think any rooms have views except of the high rises around the hotel. We ate at Sazerac Restaurant in the Hotel. They had a four course meal for a very reasonable price. We were full by the third course and had the last desert course sent up to our room. The hotel staff and Restaurant staff were very nice about it. My only real criticism was the small fridge was chock full of mini-bar treats and parking costs forty plus dollars per day. We had no room for the delicacies we bought at nearby Pike Market. So I pulled out all the little bottles of Jim Beam and put my stuff in the fridge only to reverse the process at check out. I suspect everyone that stays at the hotel does the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience at Monaco”
Reviews.Author: michellows
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love hotel Monaco in Seattle. This hotel went above and beyond. We were greeted with a friendly smile and hello. Our room was upgraded to the Monaco Suite due to it being my birthday; and they even sent up a bottle of wine, chocolates, and a birthday card. They have a wine coctail party in the lobby with free wine from 5-6 every evening and a free psychic card reader on W & Sat. evenings. The restaurant in the hotel (Sazarac) is a must try; they have happy hour from 4-8 M-F and great food. The chef here is incredible and a genius with food. The hotel is within walking distance to everything fun in Seattle. Pike place market, space needle, waterfront for ferries and you must stop into Kell's Irish Pub....it's a fvery fun place with live entertainment. Easy access from the airport using the LINK system monorail for $2.50 exit University street. Walk one block and you are at hotel Monoco! Can't wait to come back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “I wish kimpton's are not that expensive”
Reviews.Author: Bearcast
Reviews.Content: This was girls getaway. I found this hotel through priceline "name your own price" and it happened to be super value compared to what they offer: pleasant housekeepers, complimentary gold fish through out your stay, wine in the afternoons and chocolate every day :) I supposed to pay more than what I paid (thanks priceline) Do not forget to become Kimpton member, it comes w good benefits. We miss Derrick "Gold Fish" and wish that their prices are more affordable for the budget travelers like I am :/

Reviews.Title: “I was thrilled far beyond expectations with this wonderful hotel, everything was delightful & charming.”
Reviews.Author: TimWhitehouse
Reviews.Content: From the moment I pulled up outside the hotel i was greeted by the door staff who looked after parking my car & swept me into the charming lobby é reception area. There the wondefully friendly reception staff make check in a delight & introduced me to the Kimpton membership scheme which enabled free internet in my room & gave me a $10 mini bar voucher. The three elevators provided almost instant access to my room on the 4th floor, on opening the door I was very pleasantly surprised at how spacious the room was, the bathroom was great with luxury bath products & super soft & fluffy towels. Witin 5 mins room service arrived with Megan who stayed with me for two days....megan is a gold fish which if you would like are offered free for the duration of your stay. The bed was large, spacious & comfortable with 4 pillows that were all different in composition which was a great idea, I certainly slept well. Everything was clean, fresh & new. Room service & house keeping provided a turn down service and were ultra fast & attentive, reception was constantly available to provide help & advice, the staff at the hotel were ultra friendly,clearly this hotel values its staff as they seem happy, motivated & empowered. My Kimpton membership form asked me for my birthday, which happened to be while I was there, imagine my surprise to find a box of chocolates a bottle of champagne on ice in my room....Now that is cstomer care! The hotel is ideally located in Seattle ciity centre, easy walking distance to Pike Street Market & the major attractions, the valet parking was $36 per night at weekends with unlimited ins & outs. Overall, fantastic value, superb hotel, wonderful staff & ideal location, the best I have experienced in Seattle by far.

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sewonforever
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at countless Seattle Hotels - but the Monaco Seattle is a step above them all - I had a very busy schedule and a million things to get done while in town, and this hotel was such a wonderful relaxing retreat to return to. Would stay here every time if I could! Can not say enough good things - clean, friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and quiet rooms and the absolute BEST location. Just doesn't get much better. MANY MANY THANKS!

Reviews.Title: “Stress free, comfort, friendly staff and all in one hotel.”
Reviews.Author: timbo0751
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable stay at the Hotel Monaco, downtown Seattle. Our first, but not certainly last, stay at a Kimpton hotel. The staff (all of them) were friendly, laid back, and very eager to make our stay as relaxing as possible. It's the attitude of the staff that makes the difference, and we certainly noticed that it carried through to everyone working there. I stay in hotels over 100 nights a year throughout the US and can say this has been my best experience. If you want accommodating caring people to help you, this is the place. The hotel is excellent, the food was great with a lot of variety, the little touches (pet friendly, goldfish on every floor, the decor) added to the stay. The great location allows you to walk to many quality restaurants, Pike Place Market and waterfront. Go, stay, and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful hotel in the downtown Seattle area! Right in the heart of Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: sheldamarisa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best places I have stayed at in all my years of travel! Anytime I am in Seattle, I stay here. The staff is amazing and very helpful! At my last stay, as I was waiting for the valet to bring my car around, a man (I'm assuming homeless) tried to walk in the doors and the doorman/valet very calmly and quietly informed him that they did not have a public bathroom and to move along. I was so impressed with his profesionalism and attention to this. I once stayed in a Hilton Hotel in Washington DC and you had to dodge and miss the "bums" who stood inside the lobby of the hotel asking for money. I had my young daughter with me and it was a bit scary for her. So big kuddos to the Hotel Monaco for paying attention to this small but important detail. If I had to say one non positive thing about the hotel is the parking. They do have valets, how are wonderful, but sometimes if I want to get my car and just run somewhere quick, I always feel kinda guilty having to get my car out for a short trip. Never have they complained or made any kind of fuss about it, just me feeling bad for it. HOWEVER, not having to find parking in downtown Seattle is a HUGE plus!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TiffsAPrincess
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel I have stayed in. The location was wonderful and easy to find. The staff was so friendly. And our room came with a goldfish named Russell. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely birthday weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MASKK
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Monaco, and we had a great visit. Were upgraded to a suite, which was lovely and quiet. Appreciated the wine hour, as always, and the location near dining, shopping, etc. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happylady24
Reviews.Content: The staff is so friendly and accommodating will do anything to make your stay the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest, most accommodating hotels I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: kitben
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and interesting at the same time. The decor is very different -- almost French, but lovely. It's right across from the Seattle Public Library and close to Pike Place Market and everything you'd want to see. The staff was amazing. I asked for an early check in because I needed to work, and they were super accommodating - upgrading me to a suite and getting me into a room immediately. The room was kept meticulously clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Can't say enough about this gorgeous hotel and great staff. Highly recommended. Make sure to join their Kimpton In Touch Guest Loyalty Program before you arrive - gets you free internet and other perks.

Reviews.Title: “First-Rate”
Reviews.Author: Golfer88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and got a special 30% off deal, which meant $136 for a queen room. The room was just great - very classy and pretty, overlooking the public library. Excellent bed and linens. The bathroom was mediocre, but nothing to complain about. Staff to a person was friendly, polite, and efficient. Sazerac, the on-premises restaurant, is spectacularly good, especially for happy hour. Super downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: aymano2
Reviews.Content: We made the reservation one day before our planned stay at the Monaco, Seattle, and they told us that the only room available is a room with a king bed. I asked if they can upgrade it to two queen beds and they told us they will do their best to accommodate our request. And to our suprise, at our registration, they automatically, upgraded our room to our need and they we very welcoming and inviting. Thank you all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and great ambiance - beds need updating”
Reviews.Author: mellow_8
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. The only complaint I have is with the bed - perhaps it was just our room. The bed was hard and springy and you could feel the coils. It made for an uncomfortable sleep. I would rate much higher if they had a high quality mattress and sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice tay on Valentines Day (night)”
Reviews.Author: MitchFindlay
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9:30PM on Valentines day. Our flight arrived 2 hours late, so our check in was 2 hours later than planned. Fast and friendly checkin. Decided to eat at the hotel's restaurant, due to hte late hour and inclemment weahter. Fabulous meal at 10 PM very reasonable priced (quite a surprise for a hotel restaurant) and intersting fare. The room was nice, great tub, super comfortable bed, and quiet. I would definielty stay here again, when overnighting in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Would stay again and again!”
Reviews.Author: jlgred15
Reviews.Content: I throughly enjoyed my recent visit to Hotel Monaco! This was the first time staying here. The rooms are adorable complete with leopard print bathrobes. What's better than that?! The staff were are very friendly and helpful. Don't overlook the evening wine tasting. We just happen to be staying while a chocolate event was going on...chocolate everywhere! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you like service at Mt. Everest level and beyond, stylish interior and relaxed atmosphere, yapp you found the place!!”
Reviews.Author: gooblegobble
Reviews.Content: We had 3 awesome days here we will never forget. Of course my wife had to let them know we were celebrating my 50th. Soon after we checked in the champagne was knocking at the door. 2nd day the same happened. Service here is on top of the top. (if that was not proper English - it is now!) Awesome place to relax.....and hey - bring your pet. They get red carpet too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pet loving hotel!”
Reviews.Author: danimc604
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at this wonderful hotel for his birthday. I booked the rooms for an amazing price ($70/nt) through Priceline. Because of this, I was concerned we may be treated like 2nd class citizens but that was certainly not the case. Prior to arrival, I phoned the front desk and asked about a room upgrade. I expected to be charged for this but to my surprise, the front desk clerk advised me that if I sign up for the hotel's free rewards program, I could get a free room upgrade. So he proceeded to sign me up over the phone and then upgraded our room to a King Suite with jacuzzi tub. It was fabulous! (Thank you Jason!) The room was lovely. The rewards program also included a $10 credit for the "Raid the Mini Bar" program and free wireless internet. I had also asked Jason if he could arrange for a birthday note or something to be left in the room for my husband. Well, he did better than that. In our room we found a bottle of sparkling brut wine and a bag of chocolates. Wow! One of my favourite things about the hotel is their HosPETality Program. Amazing! We weren't charged extra to have our dog. She was welcome throughout the hotel except the restaurant so during the free wine hour in the lobby from 5-6pm, I sat sipping my wine with my dog at my side. You are allowed to leave your pet in your room unattended while you shop or dine, providing the pet is well behaved. Just leave a contact number at the front desk in case of problems. You'll be given a little sign to hang on your doorknob alerting staff to the presence of your animal. If you don't feel comfortable with this, the front desk offers pet sitting on a first come-first serve basis. Your pet can be tethered behind the front desk to hang with the staff for up to 5 hours. First hour is free and then only $5/hour. The staff here were wonderful. One day we arrived back at our room to find a dog dish with our dog's name written on it piled high with dog cookies and a stuffed goldfish toy. :o) The goldfish signifies another program of the hotel. If you are lonely during your stay, just ask for a pet goldfish and one will be delivered to your room in a little fish bowl, complete with name tag. The hotel does have an attached restaurant that seems quite funky but we dined there on a Sunday night which had a limited menu so I can't comment on the food. Parking is valet and quite costly at about $38/night. However, I think that's pretty standard for hotels in that area. There is no pool/spa but there is a small, adequate fitness room. So if you like a nice soak, upgrade to a room with a jacuzzi tub! I was so impressed with this hotel and its staff. They made our weekend perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Bravo to Seattle's Hotel Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: motozzat
Reviews.Content: I'm not in the habit of writing online reviews yet I wanted to acknowledge an outstanding experience recently had at Seattle's Hotel Monaco. Typical of the Kimpton brand, the room was attractive, clean, and well-appointed. The bed was comfortable. The service—superb, as always. There is a lovely wine and beer reception in the lobby each evening and it was fun to see all the pooches hanging around this dog-friendly establishment. And, even though the hotel is smack in the heart of downtown Seattle, we heard very little street noise from our room. That said, it is smack in the heart of downtown Seattle! Which means easy walking distance (or a quick cab ride away, at most) to many fantastic restaurants and city attractions. None of these things are a surprise when staying at a Kimpton hotel, and I've stayed at several. What was beyond the exceptional ordinary was the attention given to a Kimpton InTouch Rewards Program issue (the hotel's guest loyalty program) I had with one of their properties I usually stay at in Portland. I sent an email to the Hotel Monaco's manager prior to our stay regarding the previous oversights of the Portland property, inquiring if they might give some attention to the matter. Within twenty minutes I received a reply. WOW! They assured me the problem was being researched so that it wouldn't happen again. They were prompt, responsive and made a service recovery on behalf of the other property when it wasn't even "their" issue. Not only that, my beau had garnered this particular reservation via Priceline, so we were already getting a fabulous rate to begin with. When we arrived, there was a bottle of wine, chocolate and a lovely card waiting for us. The valet attendant made our life easier by offering to keep our car parked curbside since we needed to leave soon after our arrival. Our room was upgraded to a suite and and it was fabulous. I'm a longtime hospitality veteran with years in the hotel industry. True customer service seems to be a dying art, and yet Kimpton manages to hire, train and maintain a staff of people who seem to find joy in elevating the quality of a guest's stay. Bravo to you all! It's why I keep coming back and why I refer others to these properties. There are so many places to stay in any city; my loyalty goes to the businesses that show me my comfort and well-being matters... that's *real* service. Many thanks, and see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Experience was Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: rebshamli
Reviews.Content: The Monaco Seattle hotel is located in the heart of Seattle. The place is beautiful and close to great restaurants/sightseeing venues. The staff was very helpful, friendly and the service was exceptional. The room was spectacular and quiet. The conceirge (Jesse or Alec) gave us great advise on our night out - they were both very knowlegable. We are coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overrated "hospitality"”
Reviews.Author: Kuddlykumquat
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, pet-friendly hotel. But I'm not quite sure what make it "luxury" in nature. The rooms are small, but that's to be expected I suppose in a big city. However, I had a chance to visit a different hotel, a 3 star, in the same area, and the rooms were 2x as big. The rooms were decorated in a very boutique quality, with red/white stripes. The bathrooms were small, and very very plain. Nothing close to some of the luxury hotels I've stayed in in the past. But the hotel was very clean, comfortable, and in walking distance of most of the downtown attractions, which was what I was looking for. For the price I got on Hotwire, it was great. For the regular going luxury hotel price, not so much. Now the hospitality. The hotel staff were very nice for the most part, but I had read so many reviews about how they went above and beyond. This was not the case when I visited. I looked like crap when I arrived at the hotel - after delays at the airport, and 2 layovers, I looked about 15 years old, with terrible bed hair. I got to the hotel in the middle of the day, and the two doorman just looked at me. No "Let me grab the door" or "Let me help you with your luggage." Just looked at me, grunted a "hey, good afternoon" and went back to talking. This ended up being the last time I ever saw a doorman for my entire weekend stay. Got to the front desk, and immediately, the clerk judged either my appearance, or my booking through Hotwire. He mumbled a few things about the hotel, gave me my key, and went back to doing whatever he was doing. A girl at the desk was checking in a different customer, a older, male gentleman, and went through a clear, welcoming explanation of the hotel and amenities, and asked if he was a Klimpton member. He said no, and she explained how he could sign up for free internet. All of which was never even asked, or mentioned to me. I looked back at my clerk and said "Um, Im a member. how do I access the internet?" He suddenly became a lot nicer. From then on, I really didn't bother with the hotel staff. The cleaning crew were very nice and helpful however. They helped me out when I couldn't find my toothpaste and the front desk said "Oh we ran out." uh. huh. The last day I needed a taxi, and told the front desk to call one 10mins before I checked out (Seattle is not known for its cab services...so you really have to call in advance). I walked out...no cab. "Oh we called! He should be here asap" 10mins later, no cab. I asked the front desk to call again, and they said "Oh sure, in a bit" Um. No. I ended up taking a gypsy cab that I hailed myself that cost me 2x as much, but I had a business meeting and I was nearly late. I guess I would recommend it, for the price on hotwire ($90 a night), for the cleanliness, the location, and the cleaning staff. But the hospitality left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel stay in wonderful city.”
Reviews.Author: diane_4au
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is situated in downtown Seattle within walking distance to 'must see' sites such as Pike Street marketplace, waterfront and shopping. The hotel had valet parking which we used for convenience, but there is plenty of parking garages close by. The hotel staff were pleasantly accommodating when we asked to change one of our rooms from a single king to two beds. We enjoyed the five o'clock wine reception in the lobby before heading out to McRory's. I would highly recommend this hotel to any traveler anxious for a friendly, elegant...yet not 'stuffy' hotel with incredibly comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Update and Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: NeutraGris
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated in a convenient location, next to the Public Library (designed by Rem Koolhaas) and a quick walk to Pikes Place Marketplace. While the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms need some update and maintenance. Hotel Experience: 3 stars, out of 5 Hotel Class: 3 stars, out of 5 Service: 5 stars, out of 5 Room: #310 (I think it was this room) Pros: - Service: Very courteous, helpful, and friendly Bellhop, House Keeping, and Front Desk - Pets: Pet-friendly hotel - Accessories: Umbrella and Robes for hotel guest use - Location: 5 minute walk to Pikes Place/Shopping Areas, Close to Seattle Art Museam (SAM),15 minute walk to the Tom Douglas Restaurants Cons: - Overall Condition: Run-down room, need of maintenance. - Bathroom: Hole at the shower ceiling, Tile grout needs to be cleaned - Coffee maker: No coffee maker in guest rooms (the Front Desk mentioned the coffee was offered on the Main Floor as I recall). In-room Coffee Maker can be requested, but the one they delivered to the room was worn down and the coffee mug was filthy. We didn't use it. - Furniture: Upholstered furniture with stains, casegood furniture are poorly assembled and sticky from wear, Furniture in general were tired and worn - Bedding/Sheets: Stained sheets and pillow covers first night, second night was fine. Notes: - Parking: Hotel Valet Parking was $40. (It's generally expensive in this area). Street parking available, but watch out for meter times. - Sample Hotel Room Features: Faux-painted finishes and furniture, leopard and animal printed robes, terry cloth shower curtains. - Impression: Good and may be fun for families and guests traveling with pets. Not luxury in quality or appearance

Reviews.Title: “This is why I love Kimpton Hotels!”
Reviews.Author: carrieryan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is part of the Kimpton Hotel group- a collection of boutique-style hotels that are known for excellent service and a lot of "extras", especially if you are part of their InTouch program. We arrived and were upgraded to a suite, which was amazing and surprising considering I booked the room at one of their great blow-out rates! The service was outstanding- the decor of the entire property was great. The room was clean, although some fo the furniture was a little worn and could use a patch here and there. The rooms were comfortable, well-appointed. Room service was delicious and really reasonably priced. The Hotel Monaco is in a great central location. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location, Charming Rooms - Great Staff”
