Reviews.Author: MoveableFeastAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to Seattle on Business so I tagged along. Hotel Monaco had a special rate and we love kimpton hotels - so we booked. We were very happy! Cozy room with living room and bedroom, lovely bathroom with great products - our little fishy kevin passed away during our stay (not due to anything we did!) but we managed to enjoy ourselves despite this traumatic experience (totally kidding) This is in the center of everything, staff so helpful - and always love the kimpton's wine happy hour. You will not be disappointed with the stay if you chose Hotel Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “great headquarters for seeing the city”
Reviews.Author: meestar
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms for a family celebration, all booked at a prepaid special rate which was a true bargain. Everyone was delighted with the accommodations, roomy and comfortable. Uniformly helpful staff who helped with a medical situation, restaurant pointers, and responded quickly to minor issues, like decaf coffee for the room. There is a big lobby for relaxing in, with afternoon wine and morning coffee. Easy to navigate Seattle from here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sbeckmann
Reviews.Content: Great attention to customer needs -- I ordered room service tonight, and the attendant named "Fisher" was concerned my ice cream would melt -- so he said he would run it back up to me when I was ready for desert. Great bath products, well designed rooms that are very comfortable, and excellent location in Seattle. I'm writing while staying here Jan. 14-16, 2011. Free internet if you register with their website. Pillow selection and very comfortable beds. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great service”
Reviews.Author: DrDon62
Reviews.Content: Front desk and front door staff were exceptionally gracious. Arranged several rides (cab and car service), got boarding passes to me when I returned from meeting. I appreciated their sensitivity to my tight time schedule.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Monaco in Seattle: A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TommyTomThomas
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Monaco in the past during the Christmas Holidays and thoroughly enjoy the excellent ambiance, comfort, service and location. The Monaco is unique, offering all of the amenities one expects in a quality hotel, with a relaxed eligance and level of warmth one does not find in a larger facility. Their staff is consistently the most friendly and efficient group of people you could wish. Besides being a great hotel the location is outstanding, withing easy walking distance to the Benaroya Hall and the Seattle Symphony, the Seattle Art Museum, many other Seattle entertainment venues, great shopping and excellent restaurants. The Hotel Monaco is a great buy, and I recommend checking it out! We will definitely return! Tom Dozal, Olympia, Washington

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pet-friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndiPinoy1972
Reviews.Content: Valet and bell service were very prompt. Front desk staff were very friendly and nice and provided directions to business locations. Bell service from lobby to room was very quick. We have 2 pets who we often take with us on leisure and business trips. So Kimpton hotels are great for families with pets. Loved that pet beds and dishes were already set up in the room, nice touch. Although, to most travelers rooms are probably just average, but for us pet owners who take our little friends with us it's a nice hotel. Some "Pet Friendly" hotels can be real dumps and Monaco is certainly not one of them. Only down side is being right in downtown Seattle is there are limited grassy potty spots, so that's a bid of a bummer. Also, walls are a little thin and we could hear our neighbors having a good time (wink*wink*) and were pretty vocal about it. Probably could have slept through it but the dogs kept jumping up and off the bed trying to figure out where the noise was coming from or perhaps they thought someone was in need of rescue. Oh well, over all a nice location!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: OPUSHotel
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to everything. Staff were extremely friendly and attentive. The lounge in the evneing had a great vibe and breakfst in the morning was good value. Room decor was fun and unique, will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monaco and the Free Internet Too”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: Big fan of the Kimpton Hotels, and this Monaco was as expected. Clean rooms, free internet, wine hour, goldfish in my room, free internet, fantastic location, and free internet.. Rooms at the Seattle Monaco are not huge, but they are spacious enough, and the amenities are quite good, but alas, no more L'Occitane products to bring home for the girlfriend. Everyone is so helpful and friendly, it makes you wonder why other hotels can't or don't aspire to be this good. Treat yourself to the Seattle Monaco nxt time you are in town, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, inviting and very enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: twotangs2002
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in other Kimpton hotels and am always extremely pleased with them. This stay was for leisure with my young son and they made each and every one of us feel comfortable and welcome. Kimpton goes out of their way to make their hotel different (the goldfish in your room, the wine hour, the pet friendly environment, the complimentary toy from the toy box for the kids, etc...) but mostly they strive to serve and make you comfortable. Their staff are really friendly and helpful. The lobby is gorgeous and the beautiful books will keep anyone entertained while waiting for others (even a 2 year old!). They had great coffee and tea choices in the lobby and hot cocoa for the afternoon (with mini marshmallows and chocolate chips), which also encouraged lingering! The queen rooms are not huge but are well appointed. The location is excellent - 4 blocks from Westlake Center and 1 block from the train/bus tunnel which makes everything very convenient. The parking is valet and although it seems steep at $36, but was well worth it when you return to your already-packed car during check-out! Plus, they let you leave your car in the garage until 11 PM on the day of check-out, so essentially you can park for 2 full days for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: liu_joan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our short stay at Hotel Monaco. As soon as we stepped into the lobby, there was wine served and we were greeted with friendly staff. After we stepped into our room, there was a phone call from the staff to check on us. It was so personable. We will definately go back with our puppy.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, thoughtful staff, attention to detail ensures we will return.”
Reviews.Author: lynnhoops
Reviews.Content: My partner and I took advantage of a great promotion and got a $289 room for $89 per night. The price was the only thing that was reduced though! The service and thoughtfulness of the staff was way above par. The queen room was on the smaller side, but lovely and clean. The high ceiling (12'?) gave a wonderful feeling of airiness to the room, however. The attention to detail in the decor is wonderful. The robes were thick zebra print terry, perfect for curling up against the down pillows. Another great note was the height and power of the shower. We are both over 6' tall and the shower head was at least 4" above us, plus showered down with a good amount of force. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for people and dogs, too”
Reviews.Author: r0cket_j_squirrel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some very expensive hotels around the world, but I was especially impressed with the Monaco. We lost power at home in a big storm and wanted to find a pet friendly hideout for our family for a couple days. First, there was no extra charge for the dogs! When we arrived their names were on a "welcome" chalkboard behind the desk. In the room was a water dish and treats. Attitude of the staff was excellent. Friendly, helpful, relaxed. The room was perfect with attention to the little things that matter: HVAC with a thermostat! A rare thing these days. Nice shower head. Good lighting. Strong wifi. Good 24-hour room service PLUS a great restaurant in the lobby. Cordless phone. Robe in the closet. All at a price you'd expect to pay for a far lesser experience. This is now my official Favorite Hotel in Seattle and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: beernu
Reviews.Content: Although I work in Seattle and rarely spend money there, I really enjoyed our stay at Monaco Seattle. It all started with knowing our Kimpton rewards gave us a voucher for the in-room mini-bar. Once at the room we were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful fragrance and the fantastic decor. The room (solo King bed) was well laid out and kept very clean. I would, and have, recommended this hotel to many people already and look forward to the next time I spend a night in Seattle. The location was great and I was able to find a better alternative (cost-wise) to the valet parking provided by Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Star struck at Seattle's Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: tazotea
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the georgous Hotel Monaco and we are looking forward to our third! Perfect location for S.A.M., shopping and Pike Place Market. Ten out of ten for WOW factor - just walking through the lobby makes you feel special. Eclectic decor - part art deco, part circus - mainly WOW. Luxurious bedrooms and bathrooms. First class service. Best part is the wine tasting from 5-6pm every night which makes for lots of socialising and intermingling between the guests - makes you feel very welcome and indulged. Morning coffee and tea in the same lounge starts the day off nicely. It's the sort of place you would expect to see Hercule Pirot relaxing in a chair, thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hgale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a late 1 yr anniversary. It was by far the best hotel we've ever been to. The staff were very friendly and go out of their way to furnish your requests. We stayed in the Mediterranean Suite. They rooms was absolutely beautiful and very spacious. We had massages while there as well. The girls were very professional and easy to talk to. They didn't make us feel uncomfortable at all. It's within walking distance to Pike's Market, so you get to see the city as well on your way there. We got the Harry Potter pkg. At check-in we received our round trip tickets for the monorail and tickets to the Harry Potter exhibition and the Pacific Science Center. There were no hidden costs or fees. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Action”
Reviews.Author: bailey150
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at two Kimpton Hotels, the most recent in Seattle, WA. Based on prior and this experience, Kimpton is now my favorite choice of hotel. I'll always check to see if a Kimpton is available in the area of my travel. From the greeting at the door to the goodby upon leaving, the customer service is excellent. Not your cookie-hotel, every Kimpton is unique and wonderful. Keep up the great work, Kimpton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Travelor201060958
Reviews.Content: We spent our 40th anniversary at this hotel. Not only was our dog made welcome, we were made welcome each time we left and entered. The staff was unbelievably wonderful in all ways. We were given a bottle of champaign, and candy by the consierge--great advice on closeby restaurants, and they clearly loved our dog who received a raincoat for the Seattle weather. Coctail hour in the evening and free drinks at dinner--one could not rave enough about this hotel. Clean through and through. The Levins

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: drinkmorecoffee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in October 2010, and can't recommend it enough. Great staff, great Restaurant and Bar. Rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the location is perfect for exploring beautiful downtown Seattle. i would definitely stay here again and recommend it for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: tpellizzer
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in I knew this was going to be a good experience. The clerk at check-in was nothing short of sensational. The room was very large and very clean and very comfortable. I tried the hotel resturant my first night. Wow! My experience with other hotels has been to avoid hotel food. This is not the case at the Hotel Monaco's Sazerac. The food and service were excellent, in fact I ate here 3 of my four nights in town. I highly recommend this hotel with its caring staff and excellent food. Go Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “I am a huge fan of the entire Kimpton brand. However, the Seattle Kimpton is my favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Lora80
Reviews.Content: From my initial check-in (which was late and i was very tired) the staff was 'over the top' accommodating and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Has it all - best location; friendly staff; great restaurant/lounge”
Reviews.Author: travel12329
Reviews.Content: Hotel located close to everything, room large and comfortable. Leopard print robes a fun addition. Food and classic cocktails were great in the Sazarac restaurant/lounge. Staff was friendly and effecient - they went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It defines... Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Peekassoh
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Hotel Monaco and it did not disappoint. We love the central location and proximity to all that Seattle has to offer. The hotel is well appointed, it has extremely comfortable beds and superb sound insulation considering the location. We were once again treated like royalty, the staff were extremely accommodating. There is a genuine effort being made to make your stay as pleasant and seamless as possible. Outstanding personal service. We like the relaxed feeling of the place, it feels less corporate than other hotels yet maintaining a professional attitude. There is little doubt that this will become our preferred hotel when visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ninjapony
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Hotel Monaco. I traveled there for business and enjoyed the friendly staff and comfortable room. The shower was amazing - excellent water pressure. I loved walking into the room to find the hotel provided me with a pet - a goldfish named Kevin (requested by my co-worker)! In order to receive free wifi, you must be a Kimpton InTouch member. It's very easy to sign up on the internet. I also received a coupon for $10 worth of mini bar goods. Room service was quick and delicious. My friend traveled with me and was able to check out for me through the television and then stop by the desk to pick up my receipt. She felt her bed was not as comfortable as other hotels (but still quite nice); I had no problem with mine. I only had two complaints: my neighbor waking me up briefly at 4 a.m. and the too soft pillows. Neither would prevent me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “So Much for Romantic”
Reviews.Author: snowyegret222
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco was very nice. We arrived for a one night stay on my husband's birthday. We toured Seattle, saw shows, ate out and came back to our room exhausted and went to sleep. The next morning, we got up intending to shower, have a nice breakfast in bed from room service and relax with an in-rrom massage before we left. What actually happened was somewhat different. We got up to take a shower and the shower didn't work. It did produce water but not enough to shower in. 10 minutes later we got a call from the front desk saying stop showering or running any water because it's leaking into the suite below. They would send up a repair man. The repair man arrived and spent a few minutes in the bathroom and made a phone call. In the mean time, we are waiting to see what the repair man says to know whether to order breakfast and a massage. We get a call from the front desk saying we have to leave that room. They will not provide us with another room and have a nice day. It wasn't check out time yet. We had plans. So much for the romantic morning breakfast and massage. We wrote the hotel the next day saying we didn't appreciate being given a room without working plumbing and really didn't appreciate being kicked out of our room early without so much as an excuse me. We gave them the name of the person who called us from the front desk (who was a snob), even the name of the repair man (who was very nice actually) They don't care. They never even responded. Klimpton Hotels are nice but they are not cheap. We won't waste our money again on a Klimpton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Dog Friendly Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wordofhermouthz
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were stranded in Seattle with my two miniature dachshunds and needed a place to stay that not only had a jacuzzi tube in room for us girls but that had a room big enough for the pups to enjoy luxury as well. The Monaco staff was super accommodating and excited to meet the pups. They had a board with all the dogs that were staying in the hotel and a cookie jar full of treats! Our room was the end corner unit so there was plenty of privacy and there was more than enough space for the pups to spread their legs to relax. The room service was extremely delicious. The only negative was that my friend decided to open the $10 razor in the goodie basket before looking at the price! So not really a negative towards the hotel but just a heads up for travelers! The extra plus was getting free wine at the attached restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly pleased!”
Reviews.Author: SCVtraveler07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco during a one night stay in Seattle with our daughter and son-in-law. I booked by calling directly and got a very reasonable AAA rate. The service was impeccable, from the valet who quickly assisted us with our baggage and parked our car, to the doorman who greeted us warmly, to the front desk personnel who efficiently checked us in although we were a bit early. Even more impressive was that later that evening when we arrived back from dinner, we were informed that we had missed the complimentary wine tasting hour and were offered vouchers to go have a glass of wine "on the hotel" in their bar. No hotel has ever done that for us before. The lobby, restaurant/bar, and rooms exuded a warm ambience and the location was perfect, as we easily walked a few blocks to Pike Place Market and a huge selection of restaurants. And even more important, the beds were comfortable! We would definitely seek out a Kimpton hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Seattle -”
Reviews.Author: TCCLUB
Reviews.Content: Whenever i go to Seattle ..either Business or Pleasure i always stay at the Monaco. The rooms are great, the beds are heavenly and the extras they have are perfect!. They also have an evening wine hour, morning coffee. Sazarec's food is amazing too. The location is great , you can walk to just about anything in the downtown core. The staff are always happy and they have the best guys on the front door who make you feel like you are coming home each and everytime. I will always stay at the Hotel Monaco and would never hesiate to recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: lovingsonoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights the end of September with a group of colleagues and clients. Everyone was happy! Rooms were nicely appointed and bathroom was large and well lit. Bed was very comfortable. Hosted wine hour was nice. Wine was only fair, but it was nice to mindle with other guests. On site restuarant, Sazerac, was good but service is VERY slow.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mareehawkins
Reviews.Content: We had a great five night stay at the Hotel Monaco in Seattle in late September. Great hotel that's very comfortable with a great location. Even took the link light rail from airport to within two blocks of the hotel. Perfect area for walking, sightseeing and picking up transportation to wherever the mood takes you. Good food is certainly not lacking in the emerald city--try Sazerac adjoining the hotel or ask the desk staff for recommendations. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBabe
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the good things reported - great location, friendly staff, good-sized room, etc. however I did think the wine hour was a bit on the tacky side. A glass of wine and not a nut, pretzel or piece of cheese to go with it? For a hotel of this caliber, I think that was surprising. Otherwise we enjoyed our stay, took the light rail from the airport, explored the city on foot and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with kids, dogs or alone”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: You need to stay here if you are in Seattle, we went with a two year old and they had a toy chest by the front desk which kids can chose a toy from. A wonderful and unique perk! The staff is amazing, they have a free wine happy hour everyday from 5 to 6pm. They also brought up a goldfish in a bowl for us to keep us company and my child was in love with it. The rooms are standard but we had a cool big window seat and DVD player. This is our favorite chain for sure and this was out first time at this one. To top it off, my daughter brought her blanket and bunny into the bath with her and the housekeeping manager was nice enough to throw it in the dryer and bring it back to us. Above and beyond! The location is walking distance to some stuff but mostly cabs. You can walk to Pike place though... Stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Whimpsical Moorish Dog Friendly Getaway Down Town Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JoW88
Reviews.Content: Good Cajun Gourmet food in lobby, happy hour wine at open fire place in beautifully appointed high reached ceilings. Front desk help not nearly as inviting as the accommodations and lobby but is easy to forget. Rooms decorated with color, guts, depth and delight. Room service menu limited, restaurant worth the visit. Heavenly massage experience in room. Each room is decorated differently, hope to enjoy them all!

Reviews.Title: “New Standard in Hotel Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Suntraa
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in a Kimpton property, the 1st being in Washington DC. I knew they were Eurochic and had a different attitude in doing business. This was confirmed by our stay at the Monaco in Seattle. 1st sign up for the Kimpton In-touch program (free), it gives you free wi-fi and gives you special rates and allows you to set preferences. Second if you are on Twitter/Facebook follow Kimpton, they often have fun contests or secret words to make travel more fun and gets you great deals. This visit was no exception, when my kids said the secret word at check in they said that if I had not chosen a suite already I would have been upgraded, as it were the comped my parking for my stay which was over a $100 value!!!! The front desk staff were efficient and friendly, made a great dinner recommendation for a local brew pub. The room Monaco Suite, had a pull-out with TV in living room and a King bed with additional TV in the bed area (seperated by a curtain) - it would have been great to have a refrigerator, I suppose you could ask to have the mini bar emptied.... With the in-touch I was given a Raid the Mini Bar coupon which was good for $10 during my stay. Also I had opted for breakfast for $1 and used that the second day (it was excellent!). Most impressive was that after I returned and they sent the questionaire about my stay, they got back to me regarding my suggestions (thought they needed more electrical access for plug-ins - they said they ordered power strips) -- It seems like the NW Regional director reads all of the reviews and takes an interest in what you say.......... Impressive, not a form letter, but I felt like they listened and reacted. The staff were accomodating, the treasure chest for kids wonderful and our fish Ziggy was a welcome site after two weeks on the road. Overall I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Monaco, our Suite was $160 per night and a value in a big city. I look forward to staying in another Kimpton property soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: austin_res
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for 3 nights over Labor Day weekend. I booked the Hotel Monaco taking advantage of Kimpton's summer weekend special. The location is excellent - walking distance to Pioneer Square, waterfront, Pike Place, shopping district. It is also 1.5 block to the light rail station. Keep in mind there is a moderate hill if you're walking eastbound to 4th Avenue. Staff friendly and welcoming - always greeting me with "Have a good day" when leaving and "Welcome back" when returning. Room and public areas are nicely decorated. My room had a very comfortable bed, flat screen TV, and a safe big enough to store my 17 inch laptop. I enjoyed the late afternoon wine reception that is a Kimpton hotel feature. Internet is free for Kimpton Intouch members - all you need to do is sign up for the program.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Lose By Staying at the Hotel Monaco Seattle - 5 Stars All the Way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraM1551
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Monaco Seattle over the Labor Day Weekend. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this hotel. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The front desk always greeted us warmly by name upon arriving back at the hotel each day. We received several great recommendations for restaurants from numerous staff members. The hotel is very clean, decorated nicely and kept up well. The rooms are nice and the beds are SO COMFORTABLE after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel's restaurant is very good, the wine reception in the afternoon is fun, and you get lots of other nice amenities with your stay. Do not hesitate to book a room at this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and with those signature Kimpton wine tastings.”
Reviews.Author: brenne127
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, comfortable lobby, complimentary yoga bags, good location near art museum and Pike's Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Weird staff stuff”
Reviews.Author: anotherpostcard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco years ago and it was great. I've also been to the Kimpton properties with this name in SF and Salt Lake City. My most recent stay had so many weird staff behavior things that I thought I was staying at the Tower of Terror Hotel. But I really like the hotel -- it's very clean and comfortable. The bar/restaurant is great too. The first encounter was when I went to the elevator after checking in. When I was waiting for the elevator, two housekeeping staff were sitting on the couch next to the elevator and the staff door was open with another person talking to them. So I was witnessing the staff breakroom there on my floor next to the elevator! The next odd staff encounter happened when a housekeeper followed me to my room and yelled in bad English asking when I'd be leaving for the day. I told her a time. But then when I went to leave before that time, she chased me to say she didn't realize I was checking out. ok .... Lastly, I checked out and told the front desk that I needed to check bags. I was late to my conference. They called the bell services and then I waited and waited right in front of the front desk at a chair. Finally, I asked for an update and they called again. I was right in front of them waiting impatiently with my bags looking at my watch and they couldn't help! The staff need some help with training. Otherwise, this is a top notch hotel. Very clean, great location, awesome perks with wine in the afternoon and coffee in the morning, and a nice bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel with your kids, this is for you”
Reviews.Author: IdahoTraveler05
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at The Monaco in Seattle. I traveled for business, but I also had my kids and my family with me. Walking distance to Pike's place and to the monorail that takes you to the Space needle center. Also walking distance to the aquarium. So I was able to do all three things in a weekend with a 3 and a 6 year old. Friendly staff. Nice rooms. Nice restaurant. Safe area. Very enjoyable. Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect ending to a Pacific Northwest vacation...”
Reviews.Author: CDanielDeLawder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two best friends recently spent 3 nights in Vancouver, BC and 4 nights at Whistler/Blackcomb ski and mountain resort in British Columbia. We concluded our vacation with 2 nights at the Hotel Monaco, a Kimpton hotel in Seattle, Washington. We had a delightful vacation, with great service and food offerd in our two previous locations. We chose to stay at the Monaco because we have stayed at Kimpton hotels on at least three previous trips, in different cities, and enjoyed the experiences. It was an easy choice for us to stay at the Hotel Monaco. We arrived on time and after a fairly long travel day (6 hours of driving from Whistler with a couple of stops en route) and were greeted warmly by the staff - at the curb at check in and by the counter staff when registering. When we inquired about dining alternatives, it was suggested we consider the on-premises restaurant, Sazerac. We quickly visited the restaurant prior to checking in to our rooms, found the menu to be inviting and the restaurant itself to be warm and comfortable. We enjoyed the wine sampling in the lobby during early evening and dinner at the restaurant was so good we decided to return the next day, after spending the day walking and touring the more popular areas of downtown Seattle on foot. Dinner the second evening was just a good as the first night. Importantly, the concierge of the hotel, the wait staff at the restaurant and all associates with whom we interacted at the hotel were simply superb. I am in the "customer servce business" myself so I have more than a passing interest in observing quality service delivered by other businesses. The hotels of Kimptom we have previosly visited are consistent...clean, very neat, more of a "boutique" sense, generaly reasonably located and fairly priced. We offer our unqualifed recommendation of the Kimptom hotel group. It was a marvelous way to conclude a 9 day trip to the Pacific Northwest.

Reviews.Title: “Polished Gem in Downtown Seattle, Washington”
Reviews.Author: JRCABQ
Reviews.Content: Major hotel chain (kimpton Hotels and Resturants) operates a midsized hotel with a small boutique hotel feel. Staff attentative to your every request, rooms attractively decorated, and the king beds set the industry standard. Easy walk to Pike Street Market, downtown Seattle as well as several great resturants one of which is on the property. Say hello to the gold fish in thier bowls seen throughout the hotel's corridors.

Reviews.Title: “"SEATTLE'S BEST" HOTEL !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carmichaels85
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monaco several times. The hotel is a perfect location. We park our car (Valet) and don't need it until we leave. Everything is so close. We visited the Seattle Gift show this recent visit and walked from the hotel to the convention centre, to shopping, to dinner.........everywhere. And of course after a day like that we come back to complimentary wine and beer in the lobby, available to all of their guests.. Perfect. The rooms have always been spotless, with all amenities that one would need including lovely, plush robes. Staff are so friendly and help you with whatever you may need. Directions, locations, suggestions . The hotel also has a great work out room which is never too busy to use. The Carmichaels B.C,, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: bpulitzer
Reviews.Content: I guess I'll begin by saying that I was disappointed that I could only give 5 stars for service. I've never actively searched out a hotel group, but after this stay, I'll go out of my way to stay at a Kimpton Hotel. (And yes, I'm actually embarrassed to go on like a walking advertisement, but our time there was amazing and I feel it's warranted.) The best thing Hotel Monaco has going for it is its service - from the front desk to the valets to the housekeeping. It's refreshing to come into contact with staff who don't come across as disenchanted with the organization. I sheepishly asked about getting a goldfish for our room and, I swear, they were more excited to arrange for one than I was about getting it (special thanks to Shaynee and Hayden). The doormen/valets were exceptional (special thanks to Nick) and always friendly. Housekeeping gave such special care to our room that I felt guilty using anything in the bathroom. The second best thing, is the location. The Monaco is so centrally located that we questioned whether we truly needed a car during our stay there. It's about a 10-minute (lovely) walk to the Market down streets that are interesting in their own right, and about 3 minutes from amazing shopping. The Sazerac is a happening place - great food (you must try the dates) and atmosphere - and you feel lucky to have it available to you downstairs, as opposed to other hotel restaurants that "will do" if you're simply too tired to venture out. The fitness room is more than adequate and, while I didn't use the business center, it looked to have everything you would need. And if you have the option of getting a room with a jacuzzi, DO IT - they're spacious and deep. The Hotel only has valet parking which, I'll admit, can add up quickly. I had read online that the Kimpton group strives to be environmentally responsible and therefore offers a discount for those driving hybrids. This came in handy when we had the choice to rent a Prius. Upon check-out, I was informed by the staff that Monaco had a special promotion during the month of August whereby valet/parking was complimentary for those driving eco-friendly cars! I wasn't sure whether I was more impressed by the creative promotion or pleased that I'd saved a significant amount of money, but I walked away elated. Prior to arriving, we filled out a Kimpton membership (at no cost), which asks for preferences on everything from room placement to pillow firmness to your choice of daily newspaper. I filled it out, doubtful that it would actually be taken into account; yet, upon arrival, I found that we had indeed been reserved a corner room with firm pillows and the daily Seattle Times. In addition, there was a card in our room welcoming us to the Program and entitling us to $10 worth of mini-bar purchases (from which there were many to choose). I realize that I may be gushing here, but our experience was so wonderful that, even though the hotel is not the cheapest in Seattle, we left feeling like we'd gotten a steal. Before our trip we'd been torn between staying at the Westin or taking a chance on this boutique, and I'm so happy we chose the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Leopard print bathrobes; enough said.”
Reviews.Author: akubelly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here by myself on a business trip and wished I was with someone. The rooms are clean, comfortable and funky, and my bathroom had a HUGE jacuzzi tub in it; like a swimming pool! The restaurant downstairs was nice and convenient and the food good, but nothing to get too excited about. Next time I'll bring a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Impromptu trip but would go back just to stay at the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: eldfsu
Reviews.Content: This was our first Kimpton experience and we were thrilled with the hotel. The staff, who I spoke to before arrive, in addition to the staff who greeted us made us feel very welcome. They had a true desire to make our stay the best it could be. I am a traveler who holds high standards in terms of cleanliness, linens, comfort of beds, the willingness of staff to be accommodating and having the extra touches that make you feel at home. The Monaco exceeded my standards. By becoming a Kimpton In Touch member (very easy to do on their website) my room was prepared with the kinds of pillows I like, in a quite location, adorned with a welcome gift and the staff seemed to already know me upon arrival. The car was waiting for us at the front of the hotel with a quick call to the valet. Room service, breakfast, came quickly and was delicious. The staff was also able to accommodate a request for a late check out based on their availability. The location was great. About a 6 block walk to Pike's Market. Plenty of restaurants near by as well. We will definitely stay at a Kimpton Hotel whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Aussiejack1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is one of my favourites, we have been back several times over the last 10 years and it is still wonderful. The location is fantastic and you can walk all over downtown Seattle from there. Some of the rooms have an interesting flair with bright colours reminicent of Alice in Wonderland, we were a little disappointed last time not to get one of these fun rooms. The beds are amazing and so comfortable. The restaurant is still great after all these years with a southern flair. My children love the hotel and the special goldfish pet they get at check in! This is a great place to stay where everyone feels important including children

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT hotel....wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: Sal056
Reviews.Content: We had already booked 5 nights at the Arctic Club Seattle but arrived early and booked into the Monaco for one night. How we wished we had booked here instead of the Arctic Club! Lovely rooms, great service, excellent position and the bar and restaurant were really wonderful. Sadly we had to move after only one night but we would reccommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in July. It is a very nice hotel, located within walking distance to the water Pikes Place Market, Pioneer Square and some shopping centers. Its a nicely appointed, beautiful boutique hotel. Staff was great; service was excellent. Free wireless if you are a Kimpton member. They also gave me $10 free from the minibar for being a member! Wine hour was a nice way to relax at the end of the day. I turned down the complimentary pet goldfish. Unfortunately I missed the fortune teller and massage. Pros: Location, great staff, beautiful hotel, wonderful service Cons: can't think of any aside from not being able to get a late checkout Summary: Loved this hotel. I'd definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Ruchei
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Monaco as part of our 10-day long road trip through the American Northwest. We were given a nice room on the 11th floor with a view of the city. The room had everything we needed and had a character - the feature that I like about Kimpton hotels so much. The staff was nice and friendly and the location can't be beat - right in the heart of the city with easy access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels never disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jeni452
Reviews.Content: As usual, my stay the the Kimpton hotel, this time Hotel Monaco in Seattle, was excellent. The staff is great, friendly, very helpful, and the hotel itself is luxurious and comfortable. Especially enjoy the free wine tasting each afternoon, and comfortable beds. I recommend any Kimpton, and the Hotel Monaco was a treat!

Reviews.Title: “my new favorite”
Reviews.Author: mbirkinshaw
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best service, location, and rooms! We went for a quick getaway for our 16 year anniversary. The surprise bottle of champagne and wine tasting were just a few of the amazing features of this hotel! It seemed very family and pet friendly as well. I work for an airline and we have stayed in many different types of hotels (price ranges) in our 16 years together, and this is our favorite so far! I would recommend this to everyone.....really!

Reviews.Title: “Service was fabulous as well as ALL food services.”
Reviews.Author: blakesquared
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Hotel Monaco. The location is beyond amazing being so close to everything you would want to get to in Seattle. The staff was great but by far the best part was the food and restaurant service. My wife and I highly recommend the hotel if you want a nice place to stay. It is expensive but every dollar is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Start of a great family tradition!!”
Reviews.Author: kidzRNSeattle
Reviews.Content: We live near Seattle, but stayed at Hotel Monaco to enjoy the Seafair Parade without the hastle of traffic. Before we arrived I received a very helpful e-mail from the hotel explaining the street closures for the parade and other activities in the area to enjoy. We arrive early and weren't able to check in yet but enjoyed complimentary Ice Tea, lemonade and popcorn in the beautiful lobby and people watched. Close to shopping, Pioneer Square Staff and Pike Place Market. Staff were very nice and helpful. The room was good sized with 2 comfortable queen beds. and a nice area to read. Extremely clean and nice linens on the bed. We brought our dog and the hotel goes the extra mile for your pets. I wondered why they asked how to spell her name when we checked in. They brought up a duel food and water bowel with her name on it, a bottle of water and a bag of doggie treats. The hotel will bring you a goldfish to keep you company inyour room!!! They have complimentary wine reception in the everning from 5-6. We had dinner in the hotel and family members enjoyed the halibut, pizza and burgers. Wait staff wa excellent. They had a nice area reserved for hotel guests to watch the parade so it was very relaxing. Slept soundly and ordered room service for breakfast. Food was very good, but not very hot::(:(. Check out was easy and accurate. We loved everything about our stay, except for the $29 parking!!

Reviews.Title: “Pet-friendly hotel should be considerate of the next guest”
Reviews.Author: Famousel_Bigdad
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three-day stay at the Hotel Monaco Seattle. The bed was very comfortable; the suite was very spacious; the bathroom was very clean. The morning after the first night of my stay, I was sitting at the desk in my room and noticed a very foul odor. ( I had just showered, and all of my clothes were freshly laundered, so it wasn't me.) As I explored, I discovered that the smell was coming from the carpet and the upholstered chairs. One of the chairs had a dark stain on the seat. I don't have anything against pets or pet owners. But I do have a big complaint when a hotel doesn't clean up and disinfect the room adequately after a guest (canine or human) urinates and/or defecates on the carpet or furniture. This was my fifth or sixth stay at this hotel. It will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalled service in the centre of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Peekassoh
Reviews.Content: It is pretty evident from the get go that the staff at this hotel want to make your visit a memorable one. From check in to check out we were treated in a warm and friendly manner with people going out of their way to cater to our every need. That in itself makes me want to return. The hotel is within walking distance to the Heart of the City. It is extremely quiet considering the location. The rooms are spacious and super comfortable, with well appointed large bathrooms. We noticed refillable bottles of shampoo and soap, which indicated their efforts to minimize waste. They offer complementary coffee and pastries in the morning in the main lobby. In the evening they host a complementary wine tasting event which allows you to mingle with other guests and share dining and/or shopping tips. Very pleasant. The hotel restaurant is not outstanding but certainly adequate for a casual meal or Happy Hour. We enjoyed our meal there but if you are looking for a gourmet experience there are better choices close by. We will certainly make this our regular Seattle hotel based on location, comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: soverymary
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is super clean and classy . . . without feeling pretentious. The staff members are so friendly and normal. The location is great and within walking distance to many sites, but also close to public transportation for venturing further out.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Blessington
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is situated in a very vibrant and convenient location in Seattle. We had a lovely. bright mini suite with lots of room and every amenity we needed. The restaurant is also very good. The complimentary afternoon wine reception is very welcome after the day's activities and the hotel offers breakfast coupons or drink coupons good in the restaurant. We can't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, friendly”
Reviews.Author: afeuer78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco over Fourth of July weekend. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and decorated in a very funky style that I would never in a million years copy for my own home, but was a fun departure from boring for the weekend. The hotel was centrally located downtown, quite close to the Market and the ferry terminals. It was a great value and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay...highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JHarris_9
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with Kimpton before and we thought that we'd try something new and stay at Monaco. I go down with my friend and we go for a girls weekend of shopping. This time we wanted to shop, photograph and enjoy the city. The staff at Kimpton are very friendly and informative. The staff are great, the room was comfy and the bed was really comfortable. The room was clean and at night there were chocolates on our beds. The restaurant was also very good value and we enjoyed the south western flare. When we missed morning coffee, a coffee maker was sent up very quickly. The staff were very responsive to needs. We enjoyed great, warm hospitality and friendly customer service. The location is great for starbucks and restaurants, shopping and Pike Market. My congratulations to the staff and Management at Kimpton...it's a good standard and good value for $. Also enjoyed the glass of wine at 5pm in the lobby...nice touch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality was their priority”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonSwede
Reviews.Content: I felt at home when I arrived, and the cordial staff was attentive from the moment I pulled up at the curb. I enjoyed the retro look of the hotel, and was impressed by the lobby which belied the fact that you were in a boutique hotel. Service was always prompt and courteous. The restaurant was excellent and I recommend the clams for a true taste experience. Their continental breakfast was one of the best I've had, with excellent fresh fruit and a perfect croissant. The room itself was spacious, nicely appointed and comfortable. Location was also excellent, being equidistant from Pioneer Square, Pike's Place and downtown. It's been my favorite of the boutique hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel staff has it all together !!!”
Reviews.Author: plottcreek
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels have been a diamond-in-the-rough find for me. While I would love to indulge in the Ritz-Carlton or Four Seasons scene, their prices have become prohibitive. But they do set the standard for service and organizational culture. The Hotel Monaco in Seattle was a last-minute choice for me this past June. I had just moved across the country, the car was loaded to the roof, and the dog had become intolerant of the whole thing. From the moment I pulled up to the curb, breezed through check-in, and was directed to my room, I was surrounded by folks who were sincerely helpful and made me feel like I just got home. The upper floors are where the incredibly spacious rooms are hidden. And even a corner room had solid windows that didn't let the city noise in. The complimentary continental breakfast was served quickly, and they even packed a go box with a full carafe of coffee for the late-slumbering spouse. For dog lovers, the front desk and the front door staff remember your pets' names. I am not sure what program is used to train the staff, but it is working! I highly recommend you consider this hotel in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “It was the most comfortable and accommodating hotel our family has ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: M_EvansAnchorage_AK
Reviews.Content: We travel extensively with our three teenagers, and never have we stayed in a more comfortable and accommodating hotel than the Monaco. The kids loved the gifts awaiting them, and we all bonded with Nicole, the goldfish who kept us company during our stay. (As a side, self-sufficient Nicole took care of phoning room service when we left the room so we didn't attend to her needs -- just enjoyed her company.) The staff was welcoming and knowledgeable. The decor was contemporary. The restaurant had interesting, fairly priced offerings. The quality of a room service food was equally high. We have definitely added Kimpton Hotels to our list of favorites.

Reviews.Title: “I love Kimptons!”
Reviews.Author: mk02004
Reviews.Content: ...These people truly understand service. Our stay at The Monaco was no different than any other Kimpton Hotel meaning that no matter which one - they all understand how to serve their customers. It is so nice to be in a hotel where you get the distinct feeling that they are happy that you have chosen to stay there (vs the indifference I get from larger hotel chains). From the personal check-in (they know if you have been to one of their hotels before), to the freebies for wine, cocktails, breakfast. We were only to get one or the other, but they gave us all 3. Why? ...Because they could, and so they did. Had a little trouble logging my iPhone onto the (free for members) WiFi, so one of the guys at the front desk did it for me. Then called me 10 mins later to make sure it was still working. My only issue was the California blinds in the rooms.. stylin'- but they don't black out the room for sleeping. Seriously, if you are looking for a "hotel experience" rather than simply a place to crash, take a Kimpton. The Alexis...another Kimpton, just down the street from The Monaco is outstanding....but that's a whole other review.. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “a small hotel with big service”
Reviews.Author: sue154943
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I travelled to Seattle from Vancouver for a day of shopping and the ballet. We showed up at 11 am and asked for early check in which was granted to us promptly and respectfully. The room was comfortable and tastefully furnished and the location is within blocks from Nordstroms, Macy's, Anthropologie, etc. Upon arrival later that night, at about 11 pm, we were greeted and when we asked where we could find a cup of tea, the front desk manager said he would immediately take care of that. Within 10 minutes we had at our door 2 cups of complimentary hot mint tea. Excellent service which made us feel pampered and valued. The beds are very comfortable, the heating system actually works and is responsive, and the rooms are quiet. Our stay at Hotel Monaco was our second stay, and we will most definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location...but watch out for Hidden Fees”
Reviews.Author: Verdi-Girl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel for the simple fact that it was so close to the attractions. My husband and I walked everywhere from the hotel: to Pike Place Market, to the Underground Tour, to the Harbour/Piers, and to shopping and restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We enjoyed the wine tasting in the afternoons, and the complimentary teas/coffee/iced coffee in the mornings. I would definately stay here again, but bewarned - they do not advertise the parking fee which was approx. $40USD/night - ouch!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel experience in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: rgg001
Reviews.Content: I was at the Monaco hotel for an overnight stay while on a business trip. After a long day flying to Seattle then going to several meetings, I was delighted by the service I received at the hotel. Welcoming staff, elegant surrounding, upgrade to a suite, complimentary breakfast, convenient location, and more. Will definitely return there, whether on business or leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with great value!”
Reviews.Author: emica2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Monaco in Seattle after getting off of the Alaska cruise in early June. I had done extensive research on the downtown Seattle hotels before the trip. We wanted one that's near the attractions we could walk to, nice and clean rooms, friendly service, with a good price. I had several choices and decided on Hotel Monaco based on the reviews I read on this web site. It seemed to get consistent positive reviews. Well, we were not disappointed! In fact, we were very happy about our choice!! We had requested an early check-in since we disembarked in the morning. The rooms weren't ready yet, but the front desk girls who were very friendly and plesant told us she will call my cell phone when the rooms are ready. They happily stored away our luggages so we could go explore the town. They also showed us on the map how to get to certain places. A friend traveling with us was a librarian and the Seattle Central library was on her list of must-see. Image the plesant surprise when she found out the library was just across the street from the hotel! A couple of hours later, they called us to let us know our rooms were ready. I can't say enough about the front desk girls' plesant and courteous attitude - it just made us feel very welcome. The rooms were beautifully and tastefully decorated. And they were spacious!! This was important as we had tons of luggage from our week-long cruise. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. I liked the little gift shop that's at the end of the hotel. The next morning, we were plesantly surprised by the complementary Starbucks coffee, ice coffee, and banana cakes. Those cakes were so good!! They went perfect well with the coffee. Hmm... Wish I had some of them now... Overall, we were very pleased with our stay in Hotel Monaco. I could tell the hotel was making every effort to make sure the guests were welcome and comfortable. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “warm and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: riverworld
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located for shopping and night life. We walked to the Ballgame and then headed to a Jazz bar in the evening. Lots of good restaurants and close to the fish market. Simply had it all. The Hotel allows pets and we didn't encounter any problems...just the time it took to cuddle and coo over the dogs. Rooms are well equipped but pillows were questionable and I like a well lit room so it could have had a little more light. The Hotel restaurant was fun, especially sitting up by the cooks. They seem to genuinely enjoy entertaining you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, EXCELLENT staff.”
Reviews.Author: bob130
Reviews.Content: The Monaco Hotel in Seattle is a great place to stay. The hotel itself is very comfortable, but what sets this place apart is the unusually pleasant and helpful staff. My fiance and I recently took a train ride to Seattle from the Midwest. We arrived at the Monaco at around 10:30 in the morning. I asked the front desk if it would be possible to check in early as we were both desperately in need of a shower and a nap. (I assumed we would only be able to check our bags and come back a few hours later for a room). To my surprise the front desk staff upgraded our room free of charge to facilitate an immediate check in! The next day I needed to receive a fax from a local car rental service. The front desk staff again was eager to help and notified me promptly after the fax was received. When I picked it up from them they informed me that they would be happy to send a return fax if I needed them to. After making reservations at an unaffiliated restaurant, I went to see the Monaco concierge about transportation to my reservation. He was very knowledgeable about the complimentary shuttle service that the restaurant provided, and even called them for me to set it up. Although I only stayed two nights I had several pleasant experiences at this place. The next time I'm in Seattle I'm returning to the Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “I love, Love, LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: jennan76
Reviews.Content: First of all... I love Kimpton properties. I tried staying at another non-Kimpton property and I regretted it to the point where I canceled my second night and booked at the Hotel Monaco. So, I was coming in to town from out of the country and I arrived late... probably around 10:15 or so. I was tired, frustrated, and just wanted food and a bed. The front desk clerk was so nice and kind to me; it made the difference. I had a room on the 11th floor, which I assume is because I'm a Kimpton In Touch member. I loved it! I love being on high floors. When I got in to the room, it was warm, cozy, and everything that I love. The bed was incredible and the bathroom was large and clean. I have a thing for bathrooms. Instead of dining downstairs, I decided to hop in the shower and order room service. I ordered a turkey bacon pannini at 10:45 and was told it would be about 25 minutes. I waited and waited, and finally I called at 11:45. Apparently my order got missed. They were quick to correct it and I had my sandwich by midnight. They did not charge me and they even gave me an adorable bag of chocolates. I appreciated their apology and effort to rectify the situation; I was more than happy, even if it was delayed. The only thing is, they still didn't get the sandwich correct; there was no bacon on the one that was delivered to me, which is what I was sorta craving. No matter... the sandwich was still delish and really enjoyed it. Just like I have a thing for bathrooms, I also have a thing for robes. The one thing I do not like about Kimpton are the robes. They are a funky animal pattern and the robes always seem kinda worn and faded. I can appreciate Kimpton's effort to be funky, original, and very chic through a simple feature, but there has to be a better option. It's not a big deal, but just sayin'... I love the shampoo, conditioner, and soap at the Hotel Monaco. I don't know who makes it or what the fragrance is, but it smells elegant and earth, organic and exotic, all at the same time. The products were in the shower in a pump, so I couldn't bring any home to research the products. When I like a hotel product, I try to bring the travel size home so I can research where I can get some for myself. Anyone know what products Hotel Monaco uses? Also, as a KIT member, I received a voucher for two free honor bar items. I didn't use the voucher, but it was a nice and appreciated touch. The valets were wonderful when I arrived and when I checked out. And when I got in my car, there was a little package with crackers and juice, tied with a little bow, and a card inside that said, "We miss you already." It made me smile, and I missed them, too! ;-) I cannot wait to stay at my next Kimpton hotel... and I cannot wait to go back to the Hotel Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels.”
Reviews.Author: PattyDMD
Reviews.Content: This was my second year staying at The Hotel Monaco Seattle for business. I liked it so much last year that I extended my business stay two extra nights this year for some R&R. It is so conveniently located...accross from the Public Library, just blocks from Pike Place Market and there is a full size grocery store a couple of blocks away as well as a Walgreens. We ordered room service and ate in the restaurant downstairs and both were excellent. The staff was very professional and eager to please. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff- great central location.”
Reviews.Author: mmbrooks51
Reviews.Content: It had been several years since we stayed in Seattle. I knew we wanted to be in the downtown area- so I looked up DT hotels on line. Hotel Monaco was a four star hotel that came up along with several others-a bit out of our price range, but in looking at their web-site- they offered a better rate for two days. It was perfect for us. The hotel was beautiful- the staff were very courteous and most helpful. They had great suggestions for resturants and places to visit. The rooms were spacious and super clean. Great showers. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Monaco...will not stay anywhere else in Seattle if I can help it.”
Reviews.Author: catriotinct
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for the second time in two years. I can't say enough about how much I love their service and their rooms. My only disappointment was that no one answered the phone at the front desk after several tries when I called to request a wake-up call. Other than that, I think this is the best hotel and I will stay there every chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, comfortable weekend!”
Reviews.Author: tbrooksjr
Reviews.Content: We came to Seattle for the Memorial Day weekend to see family. What a great place to stay. We arrived from the airport around 10:30 and there were no rooms. The staff was great and held our luggage while we explored Pioneer Square. The front desk had my phone number and as soon as our room was ready, they called (It was probably less than an hour). Check in was easy. I have to mention the doormen. They were always friendly and very helpful. All of them smiled all the time. The front desk staff always said goodbye and hello when we were coming and going. The hotel also served free wine between 5-6 each night. What a nice touch. Two of the nights they made wine cocktails and the young lady fixing those was very sweet and pleasant. The room was very comfortable, with a big bath and big closet. I was a member of Kimpton's program, so had free internet. The hotel was close to everything and we walked all over downtown. Very close to the market. If you're visiting Seattle, you can't go wrong staying here. Thanks Hotel Monaco, you made our trip very enjoyable (despite the cold, rainy weather).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Service”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer0909
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Hotel Monaco about 2 hours before check-in and we were immediately greeted by the front desk clerk (Hayden) who checked us in early and with a smile. The rooms were very clean and being a pet friendly hotel did not smell at all of pets which was a nice surprise. The location of the hotel is perfect, we took the light link rail from the airport and were dropped off at University Street one block from the hotel. Very central to Pike's Place Market, the Aquarium, Symphony, shopping, eateries you name it. We walked everywhere and always found our way back to the Hotel Monaco where we were always greeted by the doorman. One thing stood out the most and made us a believer in Kimpton hotels and that is the service. After our first day of exploring we came back to a room that wasn't made up, we called down and asked if they could make up the room, as we walked down the hall a housekeeper was on her way to our room - excellent! We would run into after that and she was always in a good mood. Thanks Hotel Monaco for a memorable stay! The wine happy hour didn't hurt either.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cgstine33
Reviews.Content: we checked into the Monaco for a memorial day weekend "staycation" here in seattle. we booked on their website the night before and got a great AAA rate for a standard queen room. we chose the Monaco for the location downtown (short walk to market) and for their very open pet policy. in general, we also like the boutique feeling of their rooms - every one feels different. i am giving this an "excellent" because their service is wonderful. we were greeted so warmly (as was our dog) upon arrival and were given an immediate and free upgrade to a Mediterranean suite, which included a huge jetted tub for two and a king bed. it was awesome. the hotel was clearly dead for the weekend - bad weather and most people leave Seattle at this time of year - so i was glad to see that they were putting empty rooms to use to make current customers happier. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome...feelslike home”
Reviews.Author: dnewn
Reviews.Content: The accomodations are excellent but, more importantly, the staff really cares about your comfort. The warm welcome, and excellent follow thru, make you feel right at home. The location is ideal, and the price is rteasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Introduction to Kimpton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Naiset
Reviews.Content: The Monaco was recommended by friends and was an excellent choice for hanging out in central Seattle without a car. Close to the waterfront, Pike St. Market and pretty much everything else we wanted to do for a first time to Seattle. The hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff wonderful; we never left the hotel without the doormen asking if we needed help with something. Applying for the Kimpton In Touch program got us a NYT delivered every morning and with free coffee in the lobby, well you've got me as a regular! Although, they pretty much had me at the leopard print robe...

Reviews.Title: “A great week in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mugsy-magoo
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, immaculate room, great location, wine hour from 5-6PM. I wish I had seen more large dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: RickTugman
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Seattle the Hotel Monaco is always a favorite of our traveling crew. From it's location to the staff to being a pet friendly hotel the Hotel Monaco is always a treat. Your never alone in the hotel as you'll have one their trademark Goldfish w/name in your room when you arrive. Just a great environment and pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLydia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world and Monaco Seattle wins hands down in every category. I can hardly wait to return to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Very Attententive and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: superdavemt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very upscale, but not in a stuffy, overly formal way. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to make sure my stay was as pleasant as possible. The room was very clean and comfortable. The exercise facility was just OK, but they offer a daily pass to a nearby health club at a fairly reasonable price if you are in need of a more extensive facility. The evening wine reception with the fortune teller, masseusse, etc was a very nioce touch.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Weekend”
Reviews.Author: loriricher
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! It was not our first time here and we are never disappointed! We flew into Seattle for a relaxing & fun weekend. The Hotel Monaco is right in the middle of everything you would want to see or do. We walked everywhere and used the light rail to the airport. It's right around the corner just past the Starbucks. Within two blocks in any direction there are great restaurants and we have met many interesting people in the lobby at the wine social! The room was large and very comfortable and you can actually get two people in the bathroom. The service was wonderful. The staff was friendly, knowlegeable and made good suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good. Definitely Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: ExpectGreat
Reviews.Content: Arrived, but room not ready at time should be. Had to wait hours for it after cross-country flight. Internet didn't work well. Tub in bathroom had dirt ring around it, uncleaned. Waited over an hour for dinner order, never got it. The bedding was full of dust mites, to which I am very allergic. Shortly before midnight, took bags and left to go a block to the Fairmont, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bren84
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Seattle for a weekend of shopping we had booked at a different hotel however because of the area we did not feel comfortable. We went on line the same night and called the Hotel Monaco because we needed out of the hotel that we had booked. They had a room for us so we left the first hotel and ended up at Monaco at 2:00am the staff welcome us and our whole trip went from being frighting to being relaxed and we had an enjoyable weeked of good food, friendly staff and lots shopping

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ecahal
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment, we decided to take a train to Seattle for a couple of quick days away. We decided on Hotel Monaco simply based on location (which is terrific) and pricing. From the moment we walked in, our experience was wonderful. I booked online and received the option of an upgrade which we received at a fantastic price. Let me first state that I am self employed (I own a tattoo studio) and I have found my outward appearance to have a negative impact when I travel, especially in nicer hotels. That was absolutely not our experience with Hotel Monaco... we were treated well and every staff we came across was warm and welcoming. We arrived a few hours prior to check in, our plan was to use the time to grab some lunch. The staff gladly secured our belongings and offered to call us when our room was ready. It was ready much earlier than expected. Both the front staff and porters were wonderful. They were quick to offer a hand and point us in the right direction when asked. The room was fantastic and the housekeeping staff was unusually happy and friendly. On our second night, we ate at the hotel's restaurant. We came in late and it was a busy night. I ordered a vegetarian dish. Soon the restaurant manager politely informed me that they were out of that dish... he had already consulted the chef and had recommendations readily available that met my dietary preferences. It was one of the best meals I'd eaten in a long time. Staff checked in soon after my first bite to make sure I was happy with everything, I couldn't have been happier. Upon checkout, again our train was leaving later than our check out time. Our bags were again securely stored even though we were no longer really staying at the hotel, when we retrieved them, staff offered to call our taxi and assist us until we were on our way back home. Dumb luck brought us to Hotel Monaco, however the next time we are in Seattle, we will be back because our first experience was so good. I would highly recommend them based on location, the accommodations and of course the wonderful people who really cared that we had a great couple of days away. By the way... this is my first review of a hotel like this. Just like most of you, I'm sure.... I am quick to share my negative experiences in hopes of making a small difference for the next patron (after all, this is an opportunity for hotels to learn and improve), however I am happy to be sharing this great experience with you, and I hope you have as wonderful experience as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel was a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Pentwater--summerjoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located a few blocks from waterfront and Pike Street Market. Service and facilities were excellent; wine tasting in the evening was a special treat, as was the hotel's progressive policy towards animals. Street parking available around the corner. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel, disappointing restaurant, poor staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business this week for two nights. the rooms are not designed for doing any work in at all. When I enquired if there are desks, I was told "No" The restaurant was disappointing, really below expectations. Great for happy hour, but just dont eat there. Overnight parking charge - extortionate. Front desk staff - need to be more customer focused. They dont seem to care about helping guests. Overll, there are several better hotels I have used in Seattle and I recommend one of those

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, a bit loud”
Reviews.Author: Marcus779
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Monaco from March 19th - 21st. The hotel is great and we found the service to be excellent. It's right on a busy street so you can definitely hear the traffic at night but not too bad. As a few other people mentioned, parking is very expensive in the hotel ($40/night). Just around the corner and many other places, it is free after 6 PM and Sunday it is completely free. We got there on Friday evening so I parked around the corner and had to move it the next morning before 8 AM. I found a parking lot nearby that charged $9 for the day and then I moved it back to the street at around 6 PM. Small hassle, but I saved $70 in parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TACapeCod
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed in-The staff is exceedingly friendly, the rooms are excellent and the location is superb-within walking distance to all of the top sights in Seattle!! i.e.around the corner from Pikes Market. We loved every minute of our visit to Seattle, much of our enjoyment due to the pleasure of this extremely well-managed hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Very Poor Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: OzAstuteTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for two nights for business recently. Whilst the hotel is of a reasonable standard the front desk staff leave alot to be desired. I asked them for a power adapter and after 15 minutes of waiting they returned and said they would contact me. I returned to my room to then wait 30 minutes without being contacted. On returning to the front desk, they said they couldn't find one - but there was no apology for not contacting me to let me know this fact. They then said that engineering would be in in 15 minutes and they would then possibly be able to find one and let me know. After waiting a further 40 minutes from the scheduled time that engineering would turn up, there was still no answer. I returned to the front desk to be told off handedly that engineering didn't have one. Once again, no apology for the delay or lack of information. THe general seevice from the desk staff was uncaring and lacked professionalism. Conversely the porters were very helpfulTHere is no room service and it is impossible to get coffee before they present it in the lobby in the early hours of the morning. Sadly I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and found it the worst during my three week trip around the US.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building, staff need help!”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadagain071
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, neat hotel with good sized rooms, however, the front desk staff are less than helpful. The doormen were wonderful, very helpful and prompt, however, the front desk team were anything but. My colleague required a power adaptor for his computer, he requested this several times without any luck. When I asked the same question I was advised by the young gal at the front desk "We have already been on that wild goose chase for another guest, we don't have them". Oh, and if you need coffee for an early flight the Starbucks is aound the corner. Come on people, you are in the service industry!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Lolapearl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for our annual girl's trip in March. Accommodating 13 people can be challenging, so we made careful arrangements in advance with many requests. When we arrived, we were short rooms and our rooms were scattered about the hotel. A hotel representative fixed the problems to the best of her ability, but we were still not satisfied. We spoke to Jamie in Conference Services, as she had handled our original booking. Jamie provided us with an apology and a large group suite for socializing. It was awesome! She also sent wine and to our room. I'm sure that all 13 of us were well taken care of and we will all be returning soon. Thank you Hotel Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very well appointed and spacious rooms, and very well maintained, excellent service and nice extra little touches, like the pet fish in your room and the free wine hour in the lobby. Great location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable, No Hassle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennylebeouf
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Kimpton hotel in a Monte Carlo Suite. - Layout of room was nice with sufficient space. - Bathroom was simple and clean. - Staff were hit or miss, with Jessica being friendly, but another being quite short when making requests. - Coffee machine was brought up to the suite after a phone call to guest services which was very welcomed. - The tap water was safe to drink but didn't taste too great, so we requested for pitchers of filtered water which was brought up without charge. - Didn't get any of the goldfish i'd been reading about but that didn't matter. - Free coffee in the morning and wine tastings at night are very nice with lots of people attending. - Great hotel location, within walking distance to anywhere (Seattle is a great walking city). - Didn't use valet parking due to price, opting instead for "around the corner street parking" - Valet did help inquire about town car service to Seattle, but quote came back far too high. - Nearby lots of nice cafes and restaurants (Purple, etc) - Starbucks two doors down (but that is standard anywhere in Seattle) - Quiet hotel - never heard any of our neighbors as some reports had mentioned. - Gym is small but has standard equipment (treadmill was out of order) - Free internet was useful (for Kimpton members) Finally, i would say the value is decent and would probably repeat if in Seattle again. Prior to my trip I considered staying at either the Fairmont or Monaco, and looking back i'm glad i ended up choosing the Monaco. The Fairmont looked old and worn from the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco Hotel Staff, Location and Quality of Rooms is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Iceman41ak
Reviews.Content: Love the Monaco Hotel, a Kempton property, in downtown Seattle. The staff is very attentive, especially the front desk and valet. They really treat guests well. The rooms are spacious, the beds incredibly comfortable, easy walking distance to tons of shopping, fabulous restaurants, museum, library and Pike's Market. The restaurant in the hotel, Zazeracs is very good - room service comes from there too. The concierge are very helpful as is the valet staff - any request is quickly accommodated.
